title: Good hostel for the price and location
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights in end March 2023. It's one of the reasonably priced properties in Manhattan, if you are booking relatively close to your travel date (ex. 2-3 mo out). The hostel is located right next to Central Park on Upper West side, and is walking distance from St. Columbus circle, 5th Avenue, Museum of Modern Art and other places of interest. If you are planning to be in downtown Manhattan, then the subway at St Columbus circle is a major station and a 5 min walk. The rooms are relatively small with bunk beds, and sparsely furnished (a table, a chair and bunk beds), but are clean and functional. The bathrooms are quite clean, so no complaints there. There is a vending machine downstairs if you want to buy some chips/ drinks etc. Luggage storage is available for a price from 7AM-7PM same day only, if required. There is a bakery, fresh fruit vendor, hot dog vendor and a Target store in 10 mins walking radius as well.

One important thing to note - The hostel does not have a kitchen or a common area where you can cook or even heat/ microwave stuff. This is common in many hostels, and if you are banking on this, please re-think once. Apart from this, good hostel for its price point and location. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Séjour NY
text: Hôtel pas cher et bien situé (juste à côté de central parc) pour mon séjour de 4 jours à New York. meubles un peu vieillissant mais literie confortable dommage que la salle de bain et les toilettes ne soit pas individuelles. Personnel sympathique.

title: Хороший транзит отель на одну ночь
text:
Были в New York первый раз на Рождественские каникулы .Цены на отели были конечно заоблачные ,я по неопытности ,несмотря на негативные отзывы ,решила что все таки лучше жить в этом отеле ,но рядом с Cental Park ,чем в отеле выше уровня ,но подальше от центра .Ну что сказать. Этот хостел -отель отлично подходит для молодежи ,которые путешествуют компанией ,им в принципе спать некогда .А так ,конечно шум стоит всю ночь ,Двери хлопают в коридоре так,что ты просто вскакиваешь на кровати .Исходя из того что туалет и душ в общем коридоре ,то стук дверей просто не прекращается .
Из хорошего ,питьевую вода на ground floor всегда в наличии .Супер месторасположение ,прям все в пешей доступности ,Central Park просто за углом . Райончик приличный тихий,куча магазинов ,кафешек . метро пешком 5 минут .. Все отлично ,и цена соответсвует качеству .Но ,единственное ,не лоя всех подойдет .Доя меня и 10 летней дочки не совсем зашло .Ну ладно ,будет experience

title: For solo travellers on a budget: incredible.
text:
Firstly, this is a hostel - not a hotel. That is very clear on here and also on their website. It is basic; but has everyone that one may need for a decent and enjoyable stay. it is similarly in a superb location: with Central Park literally on the doorstep, Times Square 15 minutes walk away and the Natural History Museum 20 minutes walk away. 

 I turned up quite late following a delayed flight and to my surprise; my debit-card wasn't working (as I hadn't informed my bank that I was travelling overseas) - as such, I was unable to pay for my room. This was no issue for the kind staff members behind the desk and they advised that I could pay for one night only and then pay for the rest when my card was operational. They ensured that I had alternative funds for food and drink and really did make me feel at ease. Thankfully, all was sorted the following day and I was able to pay my dues. 

The room is incredibly basic. I opted for a single room over a shared room; and had a bunk-bed (using the top bunk to lay ou clothing), with a desk, a television (with plenty of channels) and a small clothes rail. It was incredibly appropriate for a solo-trip where I would merely be sleeping - and, spending minimal time. It was cosy. 

The shower and toilet were on the same floor and were shared facilities. They were clean and never too busy. They were more than appropriate. 

Overall - an incredibly cosy room that was affordable and in an incredible location. For solo travellers on a budget: incredible.

title: Pas content!!
text: Je suis arrivé vers 21h. Accueil sans amabilité, on m'a d'abord proposé une chambre épouvantable, sale et hyperbruyante. J'ai râlé un bon moment à la réception (après une journée de voyage, j'étais épuisé) ; on a fin par me donner une chambre un peu mieux, avec, comble du luxe, un lavabo (dont les robinets fuyaient) une douche individuelle (glacée) un WC qui s'est mis à projeter de l'eau partout sans s'arrêter le matin de mon départ (stress complet, le gars de la réception a mis 20 minutes à intervenir). Non, franchement, il ne faut pas aller là! Seul point positif, pour les sportifs, super salle de gym, largement digne d'un Moving. Mais j'aurais préféré des machines un peu moins performantes et une chambre... correcte. La prochaine fois que j'irai à NY, pour le même pris, je trouverai un petit hôtel à Brooklyn ; c'est loin du centre, mais tant pis.

title: Very poor room and very Unfriendly staff
text: Room is tiny. No space for anything . No hangers on the wall . Very noise . Terrible beds and pillows. Toilets are clean tho  only positive . Staff downstairs is extremely unhelpful and rude .  You can call as many times as you want , never picked up phones for emergencies, no help….

title: You get what you pay for
text: The location was central and fantastic. The cost was far cheaper than anything else we could find. However it did feel like a prison cell so myself and my friend spent hours exploring and just used the bed to sleep and recharge our batteries. The shared bathroom wasn’t great but functional. I don’t think I would return with my kids and/or husband. But a friends get together, on a budget, is bearable.

title: One of the best locations in the city. It is similar to staying in a college dorm, only with more privacy. Enjoyed it!
text:
I had seen this YMCA as an option when I booked trips in the past. However, since it’s more like a hostel, I was never able to give it a shot. I’m usually in town with others. 

Last weekend, I was considering visiting New York City on a solo trip, but the price of hotels was just ridiculous. So I had decided not to visit. At the last minute, I found that I could stay at the Y for a fraction of the other hotel options. 

Keep in mind, this is a hostel. However, I did have my own room. It was very small, and the beds and bedding were what you would expect at a dorm at college. if I were them, I would upgrade the bedding. The beds and the other furniture were fine. But I would’ve been willing to pay an extra $10 or $20 a night just to have better sheets and pillows on the bed.

As you may have seen from other reviews, the location of this YMCA is probably as good as you could ask for for a trip to New York City. Honestly, I cannot think of a better location to stay in the big apple. I’ve stayed at numerous locations throughout the city, and this one was as good or better than any of those. From downtown, to the upper east side, to Times Square to Hell’s, kitchen or Midtown, I still think this location is probably better than any of those. 

I want to say they had someone cleaning the bathrooms on our floor every single time I walked down the hall. And I mean every time. I went to see Madonna in concert and came back late that night. I probably didn’t get back to my room until close to 2 AM, and there was a woman out in the hall, cleaning those bathrooms even then. The bathrooms pretty much felt like they had just been cleaned every single time I used them. to be honest, knowing I would have a shared bathroom down the hall was one of the things that made me almost not stay here. But it turned out to be fine. Each bathroom has its own sink, toilet and shower. And once you go into the bathroom, it locks behind you just like a hotel room. Every time I needed to use the bathroom to use the restroom or take a shower. There was at least one available. And most of the time multiple options.

The people at the front desk were very nice. There was a security guard in the lobby each time we came or went. he was also very nice. All of the people I ran into were very very nice.

You have to keep in mind. This is an active YMCA though. This is not a high-end hotel at all. It does sort of feel like you’re staying in a dorm at college. But that’s not a bad thing. Honestly, the location and the facilities here were Just what I needed. I thought about even taking a swim in the indoor swimming pool, but I just didn’t have extra time to do that.

They were having an issue with cable, so I cannot watch TV while I was in my room. I believe that’s probably a temporary issue though. And I was able to watch everything I wanted to watch on my phone anyhow. The Wi-Fi did seem to work well for me. 

I love being so close to Central Park that I can leave the hotel in the morning and be walking in Central Park in about three minutes.

I will definitely stay here again in the future if I’m traveling on my own. I don’t know that I would stay here with other people, just because this is more of a hostel environment than a traditional hotel.

title: Not the best
text: Not sure what to say about this place. The location was central and fantastic and obviously it was much cheaper than other places in NYC in December - which is crazy expensive. But the place was an absolute mess.  Dust and dirt all over the floors, the cover for the heater had fallen off. I went to use the hand towel paper in the toilets and the cover for that fell off as I was trying to dry my hands. There were marks on the mattress of the bunk bed - which creaked a lot. We basically stayed out as late as possible and woke up early just to spend as little time in the place as possible.

title: Just a bed to sleep but great location.
text:
Very basic rooms just to sleep,
Clean bed and great location.
I wouldn’t probably back again to here, I was there for one night and moved to another hotel. But safe and sound to rest with less cost in costly NY city.
Staff are friendly. Showers are basics

title: Tooooo bad
text:
The youth hostel seems to have a rich social program with various activities including sports but unfortunately, the rooms, bathrooms and their technical maintenance have no relation to the exorbitant price asked for a youth hostel .

This should be a place outside the inflationary madness of New York precisely because of the social, human and non-financial object of a youth hostel. 

The dilapidated and poorly maintained premises accommodate human beings of modest means but also insects including cockroaches...

you need to know this for those who are put off by this to have a good night's sleep at 150 dollars anyway!!!

Toooooo bad because this stay had a taste of (re) youth for me...
which I still found again for a few nights....mainly because I'm not very sensitive.

But still........a little more respect for your host will be welcome and wouldn't be too much, dear friends .

Best regards and nights ;)

Sincerely

Daniel from Paris,  France.

title: Great
text: I booked a single room with semi private bathroom. It was clean, and comfortable. Staff were great and check in was quick. It was quite and in a great location being next to Central Park and a five minute walk from columbas circle. Would stay here again

title: Great location, good value for money
text: Good value for money. Single room, very small but with fresh sheets, towel and air-condition. Air-condition was a bit noisy, but not a problem with earplugs. Great location! Easy to check-in and check out. Clean shared bathrooms.

title: Not welcoming
text: Horrible bed, horrible pillow, absolutely impossible to sleep, my head is cracking after such a sleep, absolutely impossible to relax. The heating is redundant and you have like 80 F in the room which makes it feel like sauna. The staff was unable to resolve the issue. Though it us the only affordable option near the central park so you gonna live with all of that

title: Superb Stay!
text:
I originally hoped to come to New York City in 2020 but there was that whole pandemic thing which meant I could not do that. Anyhoo, roll on a few years and I finally made plans to visit the Big Apple.

I booked to stay at the West Side YMCA and was not too sure what to expect as some of the reviews on Trip Advisor said it was a bit patchy. Anyway IT WAS EXCELLENT!

Let me break it down for you:

Arrival - I was delayed getting to New York due to circumstances beyond my control and had to walk a bit of a distance but I arrived at the hostel and the staff on duty were very friendly and welcoming. They got my card sorted and took my details and everything was seamless. There are lifts to all the floors where there are bedrooms and there are three of them so you should not have to wait long to get up or down.

Room - My room was quite basic but it had all I needed. I did not plan to spend alot of time there, I just wanted somewhere to put my head down as I planned to be out and about as much as possible. My room did not have a bathroom so I had to go down the corridor to the communal bathroom which also had showers and sinks. The bathrooms were always clean.

Location -  The hostel is on West 63rd Street which is also known as Sesame Street. I suggest going down the street to the road sign and getting a selfie so you can tell people how to get to Sesame Street ;)

It is also a stone's throw from Central Park which is MASSIVE! I would definitely recommend a visit there during your stay to help you relax.

The closest subway station is 59th Street Columbus Circle which is served by a number of different lines. You can use your credit or debit card to purchase travel on the subway or buy a metrocard.

It's a little walk to Midtown and Times Square and it's a good way to see the city walking down 8th Avenue. You will also go past the Port Authority Terminal which is the main bus station for Manhattan.

Lincoln Center is close by and there is also a Target store where you can get food, drinks and toiletries if you need them.

Facilities - As you are staying at the hostel you can make use of the facilities there like the gym, swimming pool, sauna and steam room. If you want to use the pool you must wear a swimming cap. The pool is BEAUTIFUL! The tiles are really lovely. Not sure if they are original but it is a very nice environment to do your lengths. I also used the sauna and the steam room which lived up to its name!

Staff - There is always a member of staff at reception and one on the door and after about 8pm the door is locked but you can use your room card to get into the building. They also ask that when you come in you tap your card which is no great hardship.

All the staff I met were polite, friendly and welcoming and did everything they could to make my stay enjoyable.

If you are the kind of person who likes the finer things in life you probably will not enjoy staying here however if you are travelling on a budget and want to stay in a friendly, clean place then this is a perfect place.

title: No sé si volvería. Buscar quizás otra opción
text: No sé si volvería. Es extremadamente básico. Buena cama y buen baño. La habitación para entrar hay que correr la cama y la infraestructura muy vieja, muchos detalles, muebles mal mantenidos, falta de luminaria. Wifi bueno. Los empleados no son amables y no se esfuerzan por hablar español

title: No frills, great location
text:
The Westside YMCA boasts a superb location, offering convenience to key attractions. While its facilities are commendable, the hotel leans towards a more basic ambiance and exhibits signs of wear. However, the fantastic views from the rooms add a notable charm. It's an ideal choice for those content with a no-frills accommodation experience, prioritizing practicality over luxurious amenities.

In addition to its advantageous location, the Westside YMCA places you in proximity to various conveniences. The hotel is strategically situated near shops, supermarkets, and cafes, ensuring easy access to daily essentials. Moreover, its proximity to Citi Bike stations enhances the convenience, offering a practical and eco-friendly means of exploring the vibrant surroundings. This further contributes to the hotel's appeal for those seeking a well-connected and functional stay.

title: Read if travelling with a school group
text: Stayed here for 3 nights with 21 school students through NST travel. We read the review from the teacher who stayed in July 2023 and contacted NST as we were worried about the safety of the children in our care.  They said they inspect every 3 years but didn't say when they last inspected.  We will be contacting them with our photos and thoughts.  We also stayed on the 8th floor.  The ladies' shower/toilet room does not shut by itself (you have to force it shut) and anyone could walk in on you.  We told all students to wear a swimming costume to shower in.  I brought my own bedding (sleeping bag and pillow and sheet) plus my own towel.  I wore my flip flops everywhere.  There were three beds that had not been changed (hair in the beds) and we spoke to other groups of students and they experienced the same.  If you have the unfortunate delight of staying here, I recommend using the showers in the locker room by the pool.  At least these were cleaner.  Starbucks at the end of the road and Central Park at the other end made this place bearable.  We were out by 9am and back late in the evening.  We made sure everyone was tired so they slept well!  The lack of carpets everywhere amplified the noise of doors shutting and people talking.  Good luck if you are staying here.  Warn your students!  No photos submitted as all the bad ones on here are exactly as we experienced!

title: Old, dirty, smelly
text:
Its an old and dirty place with unhygenic bathrooms. Avoid it at all costs. The staff is unfriendly and aggressive.

The price for the prison cells is ridicously. Looks like a place for homeless. 

The location is splendid.

title: Good quality, facilities and location for price
text:
Stayed at YMCA in December 21 - it's a shame the TripAdvisor app won't let me edit dates. 
The building has amazing architecture and is very well located, and the YMCA was recommended by an usual guest from Germany. 
Due to severe jet lag I didn't get to use all of the facilities (swimmer) but there was a helpful and friendly reception staff that indicated lockers/printer/local attractions - Central Park etc.
The room wasn't amazing as for some reason I was allocated to a bunk bed room (mistake?) but it was worth the stay as it's a walk away from everything Central Manhattan.

title: Rude staff
text: Well where do I start beds are terrible  dirty towels covered in makeup,  all the shower handles were broken no paper towels in bathroom, then in the morning some some twot cleaner banging on my door at 9.15 asking when am I leaving then again at 11.02, what a un disclosed human,  then left my bag in storage,  and had to ask them 3 times  to get it back  thanks a lot,  I'll never stay here again. And the TV didn't work

title: It's fun to stay at the YMCA
text: Great location, historical building. Basically operates same as any hostel. Co-ed rooms on floors but separate bathrooms. Full use of all gym and pool facilities. Columbus circle metro station, lots of food carts, bike rentals at central park. Bed was comfortable and room quiet but no city views. Mostly foreigners staying here. Got to use the pool and saunas on the last day.

title: Horrible, chambre avec cafards, la pire expérience de ma vie ! Douches sales sans intimité
text: Insalubre, avec des cafards, des douches sans intimités, personnels pas aimable, désolé mais c’est le pire endroit que je n’ai jamais vu ! Vos photos ne sont pas la réalité. Il n’y a même pas un endroit pour prendre un café, pas de shop à disposition. De tous les hebergements que qu’on a fait, c’est le seul qui nous a demandé 7 $ pour garder nos bagages. Le prix des chambres est très cher, pour quelques dollars de plus, vous avez du meilleur confort, bref c’est pas correct de présenter cet auberge de jeunesse, c’est à fuir.

title: Like being in jail.
text:
Feels like one is in jail.   Well, I have not been in jail but I can imagine.
Corridors are hot, no AC, at least it seemed this way.  The front desk is
dismal.  A Y room once was inexpensive.  Not you can pay above $100 for a room with no bath and no charm at all.  Avoid.

title: Most awful place in NYC
text: The room was old and dirty - with hair of other people in the bed. Bathrooms were also disgusting and dirty. I had to leave and book myself another place. They did not care at all - they asked me to fill a reimbursement form about which I didn't hear anything (they told me to wait 3 weeks). The staff is dismissive and unhelpful. I have been many times in NYC and I never going such a disgusting place with such a rude staff. Go somewhere and don't spoil your time in the city.

title: YMCA - Gym top Preis-Leistung und sauber
text:
Habe nur das GYM verwendet, da es das einzige weit und breit war, welches auch Monatskarten zu einem interessanten Preis anbietet. 

Geräte sind gut, alle Marken vorhanden, teilweise ganz neu.  cardio, TRX, Aerobic, Squash alles dabei 

Top!

title: ねるだけなら最高
text:
一番安い一人部屋に泊まりました。冬なのに、窓は壊れて空きっぱなしベットは薄い板みたいな感じでした。布団は、薄いブランケット一枚で枕もブランケットも毛玉だらけでシミつきでした。もし、疲れていなかったらまともに寝れないと思います。また、共用のシャワールームは不潔で冬なのに水しか出ませんでした。トイレは、頻繁に掃除してくれているようでそこまで汚くはなかった。ドライヤーは、ジムまでいかないとありませでした。
しかし、立地は本当に最高なので観光向けですしただ寝るだけで冬じゃなかったら大丈夫だと思います。ただ、英語が話せない人が行くと痛い目を見ると思います。
入口が少しわかりにくいかも

title: Avoid (particularly if you are a school group)
text:
We were a school group of 21 staying here. I wouldn't stay again or with my own family. The rooms were like prison cells. Our room had 3 drawers , no cubbqord, a dirty window and wobbly bunk beds. Our students rooms varied from grim to very grim with boarded up windows . Some of the bedding was dirty in some rooms. Our light was barely bright enough to see and we only had 1 working plug socket  Bathrooms were dirty and didn't feel secure as the girls bathroom door on the 8th floor door didn't shut very well. There was a longer term chao in one room with his door permanently wedged open with a pill bottle and regularly came to the door with Speedos on.  On the 3rd night there were cockroaches in the boys bathroom. These were reported and shrugged off as a regular occurrence. 
The pool would have been nice but it was shut when we were there. The 3 lifts only had 2 working the whole time and on the last day only 1. Parents were not happy but we coped. We booked through NST who were not involved in any of the trip once there. Apparently there are nicer showers for staff on the 10th floor but we didn't get access. Didn't enjoy the middle of the night trips to the loo. It didn't feel particularly safe. Yes the location is fab and we were only there from 10-8am so just a bed needed but can't advise anyone to stay here unless desperate !!

title: Fine
text: This is pretty good for the price.  Very basic, but was clean, well located and I think would be hard to get better value than this, especially for the location.  Decent security at entry. Women’s bathrooms have codes on door.  Bathrooms cleaned consistently . AC worked fine.

title: Awful
text: Unacceptable filthy room and air-conditioning unit,  broken window, paint off walls  shocking ...sheets strained and table stained and carpet too would not recommend at all nice hotels are similar price so think again before booking!

title: Cockroach issues, poor service and they make you pay for it
text:
I came back to to find a cockroach upside in the middle of my room - it was still alive. I tried to flip it over into a bag so I could take it outside but it landed on its feet and I had to kill it so it wouldn't stay in my room. It was already hard enough to sleep.

I came downstairs to inform the staff of my discovery and was told someone could come up to remove the cockroach. I informed the member of staff that I had already taken care of matters and was keen to understand my options. I was told nobody was available to speak with right now and I'd have to come back tomorrow when a manager was available. Side note - the staff weren't in the least bit surprised about hearing about the issue which leads me to believe this is commonplace.

When I eventually spoke to a manager I was told to email the director, Kevin I was told a number of interesting stories:
1. I was offered an "engineer to removed the cockroach" (which I was told that I declined which might have had something to do with the fact that I already removed it before I went downstairs to tell the staff)
2. If I emailed (at around midnight) Kevin would have been more than happy to offer a room move... (apparently the staff working that night were not empowered to make that decision)
3. The hostel is located a block from Central Park, permitting certain pests to be carried by luggage or suitcases (haven't encountered this at other establishments though)
I told Kevin the cockroach was "exterminated" before I went to inform the staff so I'm not sure what the resolution was exactly. Secondly, I'm not sure what the point of moving rooms is when the place clearly has an infestation issue.

I wouldn't stay here or any other YMCA again. The room is cheaper by comparison to other hotels in NYC but that is for a reason. Basic common hygiene is not upheld and I would recommend you steer very clear unless you're cool with cockroaches.

title: Dont expect much
text:
Small room, clean not really, ac worked, and small pillow, if you pay cheap rates dont expect a luxury room in Manhatten, if its just to sleep take a shower it will work, close to subway, target supermarket around the corner.
Stayed for over a week, it was ok , did not expect a wow.

title: Avoid at all costs!!!
text:
Don’t even bother going . It’s awful. It’s like a jail. It’s so unclean I couldn’t believe it. The room was a tiny bit bigger than the average bathroom in the UK. The bunk beds were metal and so noisy.  

The general smell of the place was disgusting. The shared showers had people’s hair all over them. 

The staff were an absolute joke. I asked for two pillows he said they didn’t have any and I told him that there were NONE on our bed and he still said sorry we don’t have any. So he was willing to let us sleep without a pillow. When we finally got a pillow the sheets were stains and the actual pillow was made from plastic. 

I’ve never seen anything like this place. 

I understand people want cheap but this ruined my entire experience. My stay was part of a trip and I didn’t book this so I had no control over it. 

The only plus is the location. It’s absolutely fantastic! If you ignore this review and do end up staying then go to the showers on the 3rd floor they are much better.

title: unfriendly staff, unclean hostel, nice location
text:
The only positive point of this establishment is its location which is very well next to central park

The room was too small, and the staff of this establishment was unfriendly.
The elevators break down every other time
the showers are not clean

title: A fuir !
text:
Vétusté de la chambre et des installations particulièrement des salles de bains : plinthes décollées, aucune douche sur les 3 ne fonctionnait normalement au 9 eme étage côté femmes, tablette de la salle de bain hommes tenue par un fil électrique accroché au plafond . 
Propreté de la chambre : grande étiquette collée au sol, draps douteux tachés. 
Propreté inacceptable des salles de bains partagées.
Accueil des plus minimalistes du personnel.
Pas d’accès aux espaces communs.
Réponse totalement inacceptable du “guest rooms and residence director”. 
Les photos des chambres ne correspondent pas du tout à la réalité.
Établissement à fuir absolument!

title: Não perca tempo procurando outro lugar em NYC, fique no YMCA - Dicas mobilidade reduzida
text:
Foi a 1a vez que fiquei num YMCA. A experiência foi excelente. Fiquei num quarto "deluxe single bed with park view". O quarto era pequeno, mas limpo e com tudo que se precisa: cama confortável, frigobar, armário, tranca na porta e uma pequena escrivaninha. No meu andar tinham ~70 quartos para ~15 banheiros. Nunca tive que esperar por um banheiro, aberto com a chave do quarto e com tranca interna. Estavam sempre limpos. A diária foi USD 130/noite. Com uma vista linda (apesar da janela ser bem pequena) para o Central Park. 
Eu traço a linha nos insetos: não retorno aos locais com insetos nos quartos/banheiros. O YMCA do West Side passou no teste e na próxima viagem a NY ficarei lá novamente. O lugar não tem luxo mas você estará dando seu dinheiro para uma entidade não-lucrativa que atende desde crianças a idosos. Resolve o seu problema e resolve o problema de muitos outros. 
Prédio de esquina com o Central Park e a 3 quadras das linhas de metrô A-B-C-D-E-1-2-3. Na Columbus Circle tem farmácia e uma Whole Foods onde você pode fazer refeições saborosas pagando pelo peso (ideal para quem come pouco e/ou quer opções vegetarianas/veganas saborosas).
De negativo: o travesseiro é pequeno e com capa plástica, e a toalha poderia ser mais macia. Mas não deixe de ficar lá por causa disso. A razão custo x benefícios pende muito mais para os benefícios.
Para quem tem Mobilidade Reduzida: o prédio é bem adaptado e o metrô tem uma entrada acessível logo na entrada do Columbus Circle para quem vem do YMCA. Venha! It's fun to stay at the YMCA!

title: Muy bien!
text: Lo mejor es la ubicación, a pasos del Central Park, con fácil acceso a transporte público, a  pocos metros de Columbus Circle y Museo. La limpieza muy bien, el personal cordial. Los baños muy bien en limpieza también. La habitación es pequeña pero lo suficiente para dejar las cosas, dormir y no estar mucho tiempo ya que lo imperdible siempre esta afuera! Para los que se quejan de la privacidad de los baños, sugiero reserven la habitación individual con baño semi-privado, esto es un baño de uso compartido pero que se accede de a uno por vez, es decir que al ingresar se traba la puerta y nadie molesta,  privacidad total. ;)

title: PERFECT Location, Clean, SAFE, Fast, Fun, Friendly
text: The West Side YMCA elevated my time in NYC!!! The security checks everyone for a room key for extra safety. The front staff were fast, fun, and friendly. KEVIN worked with a sense of urgency with any special needs I requested. The location was PERFECT!!!!!  Central Park, Starbucks, and the Subway were all footsteps away. I will always stay with West Side YMCA when visiting New York!! A+++

title: Durch Unterkunft getrübter New York-Besuch
text: Mir war klar, dass ich für den Preis keine Traumunterkunft haben würde, und durch die Rezensionen war ich auch vorgewarnt. Der Aufenthalt war wahrlich kein Vergnügen und hat auch meinen Eindruck der Stadt getrübt. Ich hatte ein Einzelzimmer im 10. Stock, das Zimmer und ganze Haus machte einen sehr lieblosen Eindruck, kein Ort, an dem man sich wohlfühlen kann, kein einziges Detail strahlte ein Willkommen oder Gastfreundschaft aus. Das Bett war nicht so schlimm wie befürchtet, jedoch habe ich mir eigenes Bettzeug besorgt, das vorhandene wirkte doch etwas verlebt. Die Duschen im Pool sind ein Segen (für den Pool eine Schwimmkappe mitbringen), ich habe versucht, jeden Gang in das Etagen-Bad zu vermeiden. Es wird täglich gereinigt, aber bei dem Allgemeinzustand des Gebäudes, kann das nicht viel bewirken. Die Anonymität des Hostels war ungemein - tatsächlich lässt sich als einziger positiver Aspekt die Lage nennen, aber so richtig viel hilft das auch nicht, wenn man sich nicht wohlfühlt.

title: For 2 nights this was just what I needed
text:
You get what you pay for. Everything was basic but who can argue with the price and location.

I needed to stay in Manhattan on a Friday and Saturday night which turned out to be sandwiched between St Patrick's Day & the half marathon - so as a result prices were sky-high everywhere - except the Y.

I booked a single room, it had shades of prison cell about it but really was clean, relatively comfortable, had a full length mirror, fridge, closet space, TV and I think sound proofing.

I don't often travel on a budget but I'm glad I made this choice and got to spend my $ on other things.

title: excelente ubicacion
text: lo mejor que tiene es la ubicacion, es una ciudad cara en donde a veces debemos resignar algo, sobretodo en esta ciudad se resigna espacio por sobre el precio.. con lo cual es una habitacion pequeña pero nueva york es para caminar, no para dormir..

title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
text:
I stayed here during the christmas period so my spirits were relatively high as it was the festive period. However after my stay here, my festive spirit was burned alive. The location is not as ideal as people think, I travelled with friends and found most of the fun activities were closer to times square where a range of other budget hotels are located. The bathroom situation is genuinely dangerous, I feared for
my safety when showering as the glass is simply transparent. As a 6’2 male who has trained MMA for the past few years I felt somewhat at ease but I feared for my female friends and this was not a private shower at all. I value cleanliness, as everyone should, this hostel unfortunately does not. Crockroaches, bugs and questionable stains were present in both of our rooms. We were attracted to this hostel by the price, looking back I wished we spent the extra for somewhere safer and cleaner as our entire trip would have felt more relaxed.

title: For those who are COST CONSCIOUS
text:
Ive stayed here and at the Vanderbilt (east side) many times. Best about both is low price/tax free lodging in a building that has TOTAL recreational/fitness facilities (including dry/wet sauna--how many hotels have THAT). Located in mid town Manhattan..close to public transportation, restaurants, Central Park, Times Square/Broadway, LincolnCenter. 
Ok--rooms small (but clean); not the MOST comfortable bed/pillow, but adequate. Choose deluxe room for mini fridge & bathroom privacy...i actually prefer to go to basement locker rooms where there are MANY shower and toilet stalls and much more spacious...tends also to be better kept because the ymca MEMBERS use it, and there is always an ATTENDENT present. 
Common 'great room' in lobby seriously needs paint job ( something COLORFUL) and more comfortable, updated furnishings. There is NO food or drink on premises...i saw NO vending machines. Must go out for EVERYTHING.
Overall its thr affordability compared to regular hotels in NYC where the price and taxes (plus EXORBITANT 'resort fees') send the cost to the moon.

title: Juste pour l’emplacement
text:
Séjour dans cet hôtel en septembre pour un prix d’environ 100 euros la nuit sans petit déjeuner.

Accueil: aucune explication. Accueil froid.

La chambre:
Comment dire je m’attendais tout de même à autre chose. Les matelas sont tachés, le sol est sale, les murs sont sales et détériorés. Bref il faudrait tout enlever. 
Je savais que la taille de la chambre était petite. Nous ne sommes pas venus pour rester dans la chambre mais je ne m’attendais pas du tout à voir un tel niveau de saleté. 
Impossible d’aérer la chambre avec de l’air frais.
La clim date du moyen âge et est remplie de poussière. 
Les gens ouvrent régulièrement la porte de leur chambre pour avoir un peu d’air. 

Un contrôle de la carte par personne et pour chaque entrée dans le bâtiment est effectué mais cela n’a pas été expliqué dès le début. 

L’hôtel est très bien situé à côté de central Park et de toutes commodités.
L’hôtel est calme et aucun soucis de bruit la nuit mais je suppose que cela dépend de vos voisins. 

Je pense que tout est fait pour les  infrastructures telles que la piscine et la salle de gym qu’utilisent majoritairement les New yorkais. Rien est fait pour les étrangers qui viennent dormir. 

En une semaine la femme de ménage est passée deux fois. 
La poubelle est enlevée. 
La première fois le changement de drap n’a pas été fait. A ce sujet nous avons découvert un mot (déjà pré imprimé) stipulant que si un linge restait sur le lit, les draps n’étaient pas changés.  (Encore une fois nous n’avions pas reçu d’explications à ce sujet).

 la deuxième fois on nous a enlevé un drap sans en remettre un nouveau. Dormir sans draps a 100 euros la nuit c’est très limite. 
Pour tout le séjour nous avons eu uniquement trois petites serviettes de toilette pour deux. 

Les douches fonctionnent néanmoins très bien, et la température est idéale. Les douches bien que vieillottes sont propres. Nous n’avons jamais eu aucune attente. En fonction des étages il n’y a pas le même nombre de douches aussi n’hésitez pas à monter ou descendre d’un étage le cas échéant. 

Il s’agit de notre troisième séjour à New York. Nous avions fait des hôtels auparavant et contrairement à tout attente ymca a été le plus cher et clairement le moins bien. 
Assez déçu dans l’ensemble.

title: Parfait !
text: Très bon emplacement. J'ai adoré être prêt de Central Park et de Times Square. Chambre propre et fonctionnelle. Pour être parfaite, un petit frigo n'aurait pas été de trop. Mais contente de mon séjour.

title: Tiene sus puntos débiles pero en general muy bueno
text: Por el precio abonado, te alojas en una de las mejores zonas de la ciudad , con el subway a dos cuadras, conexión al jfk en transporte público y en mi caso una bonita vista al central park. Lo malo, personal poco amable, y limpieza de las habitaciones. De todos modos fue una agradable estadía, volvería !

title: Bon prix et emplacement. Personnel et services basiques laissant à désirer
text:
A l'arrivée, drôle d'odeur dans la chambre et impossible d'ouvrir la fenêtre.
Personnel peu aimable et peu aidant. 
Dans les douches, eau glacée ou brûlante, a vous de choisir ce que vous préférez (et une fois, cafard dans la cuvette en supplément).
Savon pour les mains en guise de gel douche. 
Serviettes JAMAIS changées en 10 jours. Il faut en demander a l'accueil mais plusieurs fois, il m'a été répondu, à part une fois ou deux, qu'il n'y en avait plus. 
Chambre nettoyée une seule fois en 10 jours. 
Chambre de taille raisonnable, bon emplacement et prix moins fou qu'ailleurs à New York, mais service très médiocre.

title: Extremely dated, drab, terrible bed, no common seating area
text: The two things that were positive here is that I was able to have a private room (no bath) for under $150 in a great location near 59th and Columbus Circle.  It's downhill from there.  The halls are drab rows of doors that look more like a prison. The a/c did not work, but I was able to get that fixed. The bed was the old metal coil springs with paper thin sheets and a plastic hospital-style pillow.   I was not able to stay for my last night in NYC,  went for one night to HI Hostel on Amsterdam, which was far better.  Yes, I was in a room with 7 other people, but it was way better overall.

title: Custo-beneficio!
text:
Em se tratando de localização e preço, o YMCA West Side vale a pena! Do lado do Central Park e proximo a estação de metro Columbus Circle! É uma questão de se ajustar suas expectativas: o prédio é antigo, os quartos são bem pequenos. Os banheiros (na modalidade de banheiro compartilhado, mas privativo: cada hora um usa o seu) são razoavelmente limpos (e em grande quantidade) para o volume de hospedes. Os funcionários são educados, mas sem grandes cortesias. Concederam 1h de early check out na saída. A limpeza dos quartos é de 4 em 4 dias. No meu caso, tive que solicitar limpeza após não aparecerem lá em 5 dias. Fui atendido e o problema foi resolvido.
Roupas de cama e toalhas são OK (pelos relatos que vi, imaginava piores). As toalhas, eu levei as minhas. Cama confortável de molas (bem barulhenta).
Dica: Tentar conquistar um quarto longe dos banheiros e do elevador - o abre e fecha de portas a noite pode incomodar!
Frigobar e ar condicionado funcionando perfeitamente! Cofre no quarto não funcionava, mas me senti seguro no hotel (entrada no prédio com controle de chave na recepção).
Entendo que o hotel seja ideal para quem vai ficar o dia inteiro fora (em NYC) e pretende utiliza-lo apenas para dormir e tomar banho! Pela localização e preço, ajustando suas expectativas, vale a pena!

title: Cheap (relatively), great location, but...
text: Just got back from my 3rd stay at the West Side YMCA. Staying here is a total trade off: price/location versus quality/comfort. You can't beat the location on the Upper West Side: close to Central Park and walking distance from Times Square and Broadway. The price is great for the location. BUT, what you're getting in value you're not getting in comfort and quality. The room we had last weekend was small (they're all small - some uncomfortably so). The full size bed took up most of the room & you had to literally squeeze past to get into the bathroom. The bed itself was hard and the pillow were not great (they were plastic). The A/C was loud. The shower did not drain well (though the water was hot and the pressure was good). The bathroom itself was clean. You get a fridge, but the TV didn't get any reception (not that you're in NYC to watch TV). The room was not dirty, but it was dingy - like no matter how much they clean, it's never getting truly clean. If you're visiting NYC, you're not spending much time in your room (at least you shouldn't be), but you do want somewhere comfy to come back to at night. You want to get a good night's sleep before heading back out the next day. You want to be able to take a nice shower to relax and rinse off. The West Side YMCA is hit and miss on those things. This was the worst room we've had and it did impact our trip somewhat. It wasn't great not sleeping well because the bed was so crummy, but it didn't at all ruin our trip. If you're willing to take a chance - this could be your place. Like I said, location is GREAT, but be realistic about your expectations.

title: Disgusting
text:
After we arrived at the YNCU west side hostel, it was clear to us, that our stay wouldn’t be pleasant. The bathroom that you have to share with the rest on the floor is dirty, full of hair and very small. At night, it would be best if you wore the most body-covering clothes you have as to not touch the bed sheets since you might get a rash. Also pay attention for little bugs or other things  that could fall from the ceiling if you are sleeping in the top bunk bed. 
The room looks like they stole the design from a prison and everywhere is hair and dirt.
The place also isn’t good for women. I would never go to the bathroom alone even if it’s just around the corner. The sometimes dimly lit hallways or weird men don’t make you feel safer.
The location might be very good and the price sure is affordable but it isn’t worth the nights you have to sleep with one eye open hoping that there aren’t any little roommates with six legs that came for free.

title: Todo Perfecto sin tropiezos
text: Primera vez 13 dias todo normal sin contratiempos, lo peor es los vecinos irresponsables jovenes y no tanto que no tienen normas minimas de educacion y respeto. Luego por el resto nada que objetar ya que los Dioses del Universo se piensan que es un hotel five stars y no tienen un dolar partido al medio para ir a otro lado...en fin, no more words

title: A decent cheap new york getaway
text:
This place is fine if you want a cheap place to stay in the centre of new york, with plenty around you.

The hotel does provide you with a towel and a decent bed to sleep in.

There are plenty of bathrooms on each floor, but some of them dont always lock so some people end up walking in, even if you put the card in the window. 

Otherwise the bed is comfy enough, and you probably wont be spending much time there if you're busy exploring.

title: Bit pricy for a hostel but wins with location
text: I booked a single room with one single bed. It comes with a desk and chair, open closet with safe, single bed and a TV. It has heat and AC and outlets in wall and also in the desk lamp. They do provide plastic cups and also soap. It is very simple. You have a shared bathroom at the end of the hallway. 3 toilet stalls and 3 shower stalls are available. Yes it can be busy so be smart with shower times. It is definitely over priced for a hostel, however you are located right at the entrance of Central Park (Columbus circle is 2 minutes walking distance and times square is about 20 minutes on foot). I felt it is a safe area and food trucks and Starbucks are a short wall away. Staff is helpful and friendly. If you arrive early you can store your luggage for 4 Dollar in a storage room. Wifi is available and vending machines are on every floor as well close by the gym

title: Great view from the single occupancy room.
text:
This is a hostel like hotel, so don't expect 5 stars, it works for what it is. I will recommend room(1347) to solo travellers, is away from the busy zone of washrooms and showers. However, you can still hear some door closing noise, it's almost inevitable. 
The room is spacious and it has AC, a mini fridge and the view from the window is really unbeatable for the price. You can also access the pool if you want, it is included.
Yes the building is on the old side and sometimes on construction, but you will be outside for most part of the day, so, if you are looking in to being in the room for long hours, this might not be your option.
Also, note that there is a bakery, fruit shop and Restaurant on the west side of the street, opposite to the park. I wish I had found these before, but, oh well.
There is also a grocery store in the Columbus circle for you to grab some basic food if you are on a budget.
Like in any other place, keep your food closed and tide or bugs will come and eat it for you.
Line 1 (red) takes you to Columbus Circle stop which is 3 block away.

The Y is right where Central Park is, and the MOMA is walking distance (10 min)
Walk a little more and you can get to Times Square. I went there at night and the walk was enjoyable and safe (8pm)

Hope it helps.

title: Disgusting Hostel
text:
Disgusting facilities, dirty rooms, dirty beds, and cockroaches... When I emailed them to inform them about this, they asked me if I brought it in from outside.... Not sure how you carry in a cockroach that big. 

The bathrooms are barely cleaned and even though the location is great, it's really not worth it.

title: Best Value for the a Stay, Location can't be beat!
text: Firstly, this is the YMCA, not the Ritz-Carlton.  PROS:  Check-in is easy.  The room is basic but the mattress is comfortable.  Free wifi (look for password displayed on the wall near the elevator of your floor).  There is keyed entry to the women's room (though everyone on the floor shares it) -- 3 stalls, 3 showers, and 4 sinks.  The secret sauce to bathing in shared space is to wear a bikini and flip-flops.  There is a separate bathroom for men. Each room has a window air conditioner, closet space, desk.  Towels and soap are provided (no washcloths).  During my stay, housekeeping is every 4 days (which is OK with me, I prefer more privacy).  Security to the property is pretty good, you must use your key card during the day and exterior doors are locked in the evening.  You have access to the pool/gym facilities.  Central Park, subway, pharmacy, a bakery, convenience stores, food stands are all within a 5 minute walk.  The location can't be beat for a budget stay in New York.  CONS:  Halls and restrooms have little to no AC (it's like a sauna).  Sometimes the ladies restroom door is not closed properly (less secure, but I had no problem). The shower drains don't clear very well.  In 1 or 2 minutes, you'll be standing in 2 inches of water (and showers are not cleaned after each use).  There is a $10 per night fee.  This may not be obvious when you book but it is in the fine print (payment is due at check-in). Otherwise, a great place to lay your head and see the city while paying a fraction of what other hotels charge. I saved over $500 with a 2-night stay but I don't think I could have stayed longer.

title: Good location place not very good
text: This hostel is near central park and the subway is just 5 min away. The room was not very clean and the AC made lot of noise, the bed was not comfortable and the bathrooms were always dirty with hairs everywhere. The place didn’t have a kitchen or entertaining areas like other hostels do. I wouldn’t stay here again.

title: Cheap
text: They charged mu credit card when I booked. Not mentioned when I booked. They say front desk is open 24 hours and daily housekeeping. NO! After 4 days I had to demand that my room be cleaned. When the front desk was closed in the morning, no WIFI connection. I was not told anything about the facilities available to guests when I checked in.

title: Pésima experiencia
text: Nuestra peor experiencia en un Hostel: el trato del personal de seguridad es maleducado y roza lo violento. Se manejan de forma irrespetuosa, despreciando a los huéspedes del lugar. Las habitaciones son sucias -la limpieza es deficiente, a tal punto que es insalubre. Tuvimos grandes crisis de alergia debido a la mugre de restos humanos que encontramos debajo del cubre camas (adjuntamos imágenes). El servicio de wi-fi es deficiente: la aplicación Grindr está bloqueada y cualquier sitio web de contenido gay también, es decir, censuran la conexión wi-fi y no hay señal para usar conexión por celular. Nunca antes viví una censura de ese tipo en un hospedaje. El hostel no cuenta con lugares de encuentro para conversar y hacer amigos como si lo tienen otros hostels. Hay tres duchas por piso lo que hace que siempre esten ocupadas, descontando que las puertas son transparentes y SE VE TODO. Basicamente es como una carcel sucia con personal maleducado, en el medio de una de las ciudades mas libres del mundo. No lo recomendamos en absoluto, y le pedimos a la comunidad gay que no le dé su dinero a este tipo de lugares donde la censura prevalece.

title: Cucarachas
text: Por el precio y por ser un hostal está relativamente bien, la ubicación es buena, las literas qué hay no son súper cómodas pero están bien, eso si rechinan cada que te mueves. El baño lo teníamos compartido, no estaba tan mal, obviamente el área del las regaderas estaba constantemente mojada, pero lo peor fue que comenzaron a salir cucarachas en nuestro cuarto por todas partes, de A/C, de una tubería en el techo, del pasillo se metían, en menos de una hora llegamos a matar 5, finalmente bajamos a la recepción para que nos cambiaron de cuarto, la señora de muy mala gana al final lo hizo, no sin antes llamar a mantenimiento, que incluso el le dijo que nos cambiara porque no tenían insecticida, y después llamo por teléfono a alguien más para hacerlo. Nos dijo que no eran cucarachas, que eran “water bugs” o bichos de agua, pero somos de mexico sabemos bien como se ve una cucaracha y esas eran cucarachas, incluso una de ellas se metió a mi maleta estaban por todas partes, no se si sería cosa del piso porque incluso nuestro piso (11)  olía raro, y bajamos después en otro piso y se veía y olía completamente diferente

title: Cheap accommondation at good location
text: I had a one-person room with a shared bathroom. The room was small and the A/C unit was very noisy and it could not be used while sleeping. This hostel is a good choice if you need cheap accommodation for a couple of nights near the Columbus Circle.

title: You get what you pay for
text:
Thought I would save some money while attending a concert at The Beacon. The AC worked very well and the room was clean. That’s about all I can say. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and the pillow was tiny.  You get what you pay for. Next time I’ll pay the extra for a hotel room.  
I’m sure it would be fine for other people. The staff was very nice, it just wasn’t for me.

title: DECEPTION POUR LE PRIX PAYE
text: Nous avons séjourné 8 jours dans cet YMCA en chambre double avec salle de bain privé. Chambre très petite, lit pas très confortable et peu de place pour 147 $. A ce prix là, vous pouvez avoir un hôtel avec plus de confort si vous réservez longtemps à l'avance. Les sanitaires sont archaïques, la chasse d'eau fait un bruit d'enfer! Il y a avait une salle au RDC ou l'on pouvait boire un café, lire et échanger et elle est fermée. Un seul point positif près du métro et de central park. Le lit a été fait une fois en 8 jours et les serviettes changées également 1 fois sachant qu'il n'y avait pas d'aération dans la chambre et que lorsqu'on rentrait on étouffait ce d'autant plus que la clim ne fonctionnait pas ou mal et ça sentait mauvais.Si vous voulez un minimum de confort vous ne vous y retrouverez pas ! A chaque fois que vous rentrez vous devez enregistrer votre carte auprès de la sécurité. Piscine non testée.

title: Buena opción de hospedaje!
text: Buen hospedaje. Baños semiprivados siempre disponibles y limpios. Buena opción para lo caro que es NY. Buenísima ubicación. Es cierto que no pasan a limpiar y suelen ser un poco fastidiosos ante las preguntas.

title: Great location--bring your bathing suit!
text: There aren't many affordable options in NYC so I was happy to discover this place. It's halfway between a hostel and a hotel. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are shared and there are no communal kitchens or microfridges in the room. But you are paying a "resort fee" to have access to the YMCA's gym and pool so you might as well take advantage of it. They do require a swim cap but they sell them at the front desk if you don't have one. The pool also special hours on weekends and holidays so you can't use it whenever but it's still a great perk. It's easy walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and Columbus Circle. There are several food trucks around the corner as well as a Starbucks, Target and Whole Foods within 5 minutes walk.

title: ESPELUNCA
text:
Hotel horrível, prédio velho, sem manutenção, funcionários grosseiros, o quarto tinha saco de lixo (???) nas laterais do ar condicionado ajudando a vedar a janela que entrava vento. Passei frio uma noite.
Banheiro coletivo com manutenção insuficiente, ficava uma nojeira; serviço de quarto não passou uma vez ao menos em seis dias que fiquei lá. Colchão horroroso, janela com praticamente nada pra barrar a claridade.
Não tenho nada de positivo pra falar sobre esse hotel. Toalha parecia um papel de tão fina. 
Essa espelunca nem deveria estar funcionando.
Não fiquem se não quiserem estragar a viagem de vocês. Paguem um pouquinho mais e sejam melhor tratados.

title: YMCA
text:
Gustó · El hostal tiene muy buena ubicación y buena conectividad a través del metro.
The hostel has a very good location and good connectivity through the metro.

No gustó · El personal de seguridad que trabaja está un poco quemado. Se debería aumentar la frecuencia de limpieza de los aseos para no encontrar imprevistos.
The security personnel that work are a bit burnt out. The frequency of cleaning the toilets should be increased so as not to encounter unforeseen events.

title: Kind of dirty
text:
The best location. Across the street from Central Park. Right beside Madonna’s apartment!  BUT:

The walls badly need repainting. The rooms are dirty. The bed wasn’t completely fresh, I took it apart and found some hairs and the comforter cover looked used with some weird dirt on it. Gross!!!! I don’t think they wash it with each guest. 

The bathrooms were very clean (I had the deluxe room with semi private bathroom.) The cleaning staff seems on top of it. The air conditioning barely worked and the room was hot and stuffy in April. I wonder how bad it gets in July?

I won’t stay here again but it was an interesting experience. I guess it’s an OK option for those peak periods when everything is $300/night.

title: No frills, but wow - what a location!
text: The West Side YMCA is definitely a no frills place to stay, but the location is excellent. You're right next to Central Park and Columbus Circle. Times Square is an easy walk south. We stayed in 2 different rooms. The first had a bunk bed and was quite small, but the bed was comfy and the room was clean. It also had a small TV and fridge. We had a semi-private bathroom, which was down the hall. This meant we had to scan our key on one of the bathroom doors to get in, but once inside we had privacy while we got cleaned up. The bathrooms were kept clean and tidy. We were able to upgrade the second half of our stay to a room with a larger bed and an in room bathroom. Again, this hotel is no frills. It can be rough around the edges, but it's clean and comfortable at the end of a long day of sightseeing. We did not have time to take advantage of the gym, the pool, the sauna, and stuff like that, but they looked nice. I'd recommend the West Side YMCA. If you're visiting NYC, you should be out doing stuff, not sitting around the room. It was everything we needed it to be.

title: Not safe for victims of Japan - they let them affect the guest
text: I am doubtful about their security - definitely the Japanese harassment was perfectly implemented in the way that they get more supports with less spend than victims paying the fee for deteriorated services only to serve the Japanese harassment groups. Else, it was fine. A YMCA facility. Something you can imagine for YMCA guest accommodations would be all set and ready to welcome you.

title: Mais ou menos
text: Por ser em Manhattan e pela localização acho que compensa, mas o meu quarto estava bem sujo, com lixo e macarrão cru pelo chão (???), as toalhas eram bem encardidas e o lençol não estava cheiroso. Mas o banheiro compartilhado estava sempre limpo e o feminino tinha senha, que achei ótimo!

title: Awuful experience!!
text:
I've taken a reservation for 1 person , 8-11 January 2022.

On Jan 2nd I was involved in a major car accident in the USA and immediately I've sent the cancellation, offering to send the Hospital and Police reports .

My credid card was immediatelly charged 100% for 3 days..
I've written to the management..no reply if not : your card was charged of the due amount..Thank you very much!! 

I hope you'll find in a similar situation the same hearthfull comprehension!!

title: Cause for concern
text: The chemicals they use to clean around the pool are toxic. (I don't know about the rooms, but They use the toxic chemicals when members are still swimming. This is a Health Hazard. Require and pay staff to stay later so they can use the toxic chemicals after swimmers, that is, paying members, have left. According to Glassdoor: "Chief Executive Officer salaries at YMCA are as high as $309,620 per year."  "Sharon Greenberger, President/CEO of YMCA Greater New York: $793,875" You can afford it.

title: No asumen responsabilidad ni precaución
text:
En este alojamiento me pasaron 3 cosas inaceptables y que no tuvieron respuesta satisfactoria:
1) la conexión a Internet no funciona bien, se los señalé en la recepción y dijeron que iban a hablar "con el ingeniero", sin embargo nunca funcionó bien ni WhatsApp.
2) dos veces me quedé atrapado en el ascensor llegando al piso 10, donde no abría bien la puerta, luego se cerraba y comenzaba a bajar rápidamente (si esto te pasa debes apretar rápidamente el botón al primer piso). Se los señalé asustado a la gente de recepción y dijeron que le iban a decir "al ingeniero". No me pidieron disculpas, así como tampoco dejaron fuera de servicio el ascensor pese al peligro que representaba.
3) el alojamiento cuenta con servicio de check out tardío, consulté -con días de anticipación- por esta opción en la recepción y me dijeron que no había problema con dejar la habitación a las 3pm, y les volví a preguntar para confirmar que todo estaba OK. El día del check out a las 1:30pm un señor del staff fue a mi habitación a decir que me tenia que ir de inmediato. Le señalé la información que me dijeron dos personas en la recepción y le describí cómo eran físicamente (ya que no usan identificación) y aún así de forma insolente me dijo que recogiera de inmediato mis cosas y me fuera, ya que si no lo hacía, sería desalojado con seguridad. Fui a la recepción a pedir hablar con el encargado y me atendió Jorge Pacas, a quien le expuse la humillación que había sufrido en pleno pasillo del piso 10, y quien de forma amable no me dio más que 30 minutos para tomar mis cosas e irme, pues tenían que entregar la habitación a nuevos huéspedes. Nunca se hicieron responsables por la información que me habían entregado en la misma recepción y tampoco pidieron disculpas por amenazarme con seguridad.

Francamente salí molesto y nervioso del alojamiento, pues el personal de la recepción es quien entrega la información a los huéspedes, sin embargo ellos mismos después ponen en duda todo. Son muy irresponsables en la atención al cliente y no se hacen cargo de sus falencias.

Un último detalle es el aseo, en general siempre los baños sucios y nunca fueron a limpiar la habitación. En pandemia es mala cosa. Hay alojamientos mejores por el precio de YMCA y con un sentido de atención al cliente propio de USA.

No se los recomiendo.

title: Todo perfecto
text: Excelente lugar y ubicación, muy amables todos en especial Luigi y  Mario !!!!! Lo recomiendo y además estas cerca de todo, también podes utilizar los vestuarios, gym y pileta. Lugar ideal para estar cerca de todo, no gastar tanto y aprovechar Manhattan !!!

title: mala atención , solo la ubicación vale la pena
text: tenias que rogar para la limpieza de habitación. la mayoría  habla solo ingles y el que habla castellano no te trata de buena manera. los dispenser de alcohol no , mal humor en general de los empleados

title: Excelente precio y ubicación
text: Muy buena opción por su precio razonable y la impecable ubicación. Recibieron nuestros pedidos de Amazon y entregaron amablemente cuando llegamos. No utilizamos el gimnasio ni pileta. Lo recomiendo para viajar en pareja con presupuesto medio, te ahorras el metro y estas a metros de Central Park.

title: Medical trip
text:
The handicap bathrooms were TERRIBLE for a truly handicap person. Which I am. I severe handicap person CAN NOT step into a bathtub. Why are there not walk in showers?? The hand rails are unusable as well. They are slick and I was not able to lift myself from the non handicap size toilet as well. 
Of course the breakfast have had to
Change but the boiled eggs were spoiled. They were horrible. Please check your food items before eating and especially serving.

title: Clean & Safe + super located! 'Gut' für einen kurzen Citytrip!
text:
Okay, gemütlich und hübsch ist anders. Es kommt immer drauf an, was man von einer günstigen Unterkunft in Manhattan erwartet. Mein Motto war: ich bin ja nur hier zum schlafen. 
Die Unterkunft ist leicht zu finden und liegt super Nahe am Central Park. Wir haben die subway nur genommen, wenns geregnet hat; ansonsten Turnschuhe an und alles per Fuß erkundbar - und genau darauf kam es uns an. 
Wir hatten die günstigste Variante gebucht: ein Zimmer für 2 Personen. Die Anordnung der Zimmer und deren Ausstattung haben wir einfach mit Humor genommen: es gibt einem das Gefühl, als wäre man im Gefängnis gelandet! Doppelstockbett, seltsames Fenster und irgendwie absolut ungemütlich - schaut euch meine Fotos an! Wie die Betten sind, kann ich gar nicht sagen, nach dem ganzen Sightseeing, Shoppen und Essen sind wir immer todmüde ins Bett gefallen und haben wunderbar geschlafen!

Positiv war definitiv der Portier: keiner kommt ins Gebäude ohne Hotelkarte oder YMCA-Mitgliederausweis.

Gemeinschaftsbäder waren simpel aber sauber

Ich würde es wieder buchen: Preisleistung und Location waren einfach zu gut!

title: Vale quanto se paga
text: O lugar é bastante simples. Um quartinho pequeno com cama, mesa e TV simples, banheiro coletivo, mas tudo muito limpo, organizado, barato, bem localizado, e tranquilo, só é muito difícil de achar vaga. Faz bastante tempo que fui acho que 2014

title: Außer der Lage nicht zu empfehlen.
text:
Zuerst das gute: Die Lage ist unfassbar gut, da es direkt am Central Park gelegen ist. Paar Meter weiter ist auch der Columbus Circle mit Einkaufsmöglichkeiten und guter Verkehrsanbindung.

Davon abgesehen ist es leider nicht empfehlen. Die Zimmer erinnern an ein Gefängnis. Die Matratzen sind vollkommen durch, sodass man jede Metallfeder beim Schlafen spürt. 

In Ordnung waren die Gemeinschaftsbäder, da diese immer ausreichend sauber waren.

title: Volvería una y mil veces a este hotel/hostal
text: Está cerquísima de todo, nada más sales chocas con Central Park. Hay supermercados cerca, con infinidad de comida preparada que te la puedes llevar a la sala del hotel. Tiene dos piscinas, gimnasio etc. Si vuelvo a NY seguro que repito

title: Nice
text: Very good for the price. If you just want somewhere clean and comfy for a decent price, then you found the right place. If you’re kind of cool with sharing bathroom but still a bit reluctant, then I recommend the deluxe room, then you can lock the door and they are very clean and fresh. Friendly staff and secure.

title: Dirty!!
text: Stayed here during a university trip and although the price and location are good, the state of the rooms / facilities are not! Our room had dirty water, hairs, black mould, on the floors and walls. - a long with other mysterious stains and marks! The bottom bunk had wet chewing gum on the frame and the bathroom facilities are not clean either!!

title: Not bad at all for the price!
text: As students, my friend and I were looking for a cheap place to rest our heads, shower and store our possessions. The YMCA ticks all of those boxes, and although it is not luxurious, the room was just what we needed. The room was pretty small, but to be honest we only spent time there when we were sleeping! You can't go wrong for the money and the location - just a 15 minute walk to Times Square.

title: Excelente lugar, excelente ubicación.
text:
Cumple con todo lo pactado, habitación tamaño estándar, con escritorio y una silla. Limpieza de habitación todos los días. Limpieza de los baños a todo momento.
Cercanía con estación de subte central como Columbus, que pasan casi todas las líneas, a media cuadra del Central Park, y fácil acceso a Broadway.

title: 5 days in front of central park
text: The hotel/hostel is very nice, full of traveler and student, my room (very little) was in front od Central Park (see the pictures) on the fall season (autumn). Very easy to reach the near metro and other services. Room and bathroom clened. At the 7 am people noise.

title: My Old Stomping Grounds!
text: I spent most of my adult life in NYC, on the UpperWestside. I was a member of the Westside YMCA for almost 25 years. When I visit, I stay in the guest rooms. I love the amenity of a terrific gym, a Spanish tiled 25 yard pool, and access to Lincoln Center. I love the value and neighborhood.

title: Muy recomendable
text:
Volvería a ir! el lugar tiene una excelente ubicación, la gente es muy amable y la limpieza es muy buena. Si bien hay gente de recepción que no habla español, siempre tratan de ayudarte. Las chicas del bar todas hablan español y son muy muy amables también.
Nunca vimos los baños sucios, siempre hubo limpieza tanto en la habitación como en el resto del hostel. Estuve 12 días y la pase increíble, La verdad que superó mis expectativas.

title: Bad hostel
text:
We stayed there for 1 week and we didn’t like it.
Small rooms, dirty room, we asked for cleaning but they didn’t clean for like 2 days, and you share bathrooms.
Plus you have to pay a extra fee for the time you stay there, 60$ for the fitness floor... no information about that before we booked the room.

title: Worse than imagined. Do not risk staying there!  Awful.Bad.Unbelievable actually!
text:
Stayed there for 7 nights.  The bunk beds were loose, ready to fall apart. The door didn't have an inside lock, then they put one on, that I could open from the hallway? There is one bathroom for the whole large floor. The main pool was closed for repairs. The $10 a day fee was charged to me each day, though 2 of the 8 days, the ammenities were not operational for the holidays. The staff are big liars.  They said an upgrade would cost me 250.00 more per night?  The bed is soft and squeaky, and the comforter had a large whole right at the top for your face. No heat in winter. Cold.
-the only good was some kindness from the cleaner, and the cafe was alright.

title: La ubicación lo compensa todo
text:
Viajamos mi marido y yo y reservamos una habitación doble y al ser una litera pasamos esos días dormidos separados, al menos estábamos tranquilos solos los dos. Eso sí, a la hora de acostarnos ese metal de la litera hacia un ruido escandaloso! que podían pensar los vecinos en otra cosa perfectamente jajajaj. Los colchones estaban bien para descansar.
El momento del check-in fue un poco lento, eran sobre las 7pm y solo había una chica. La limpieza no era mala teniendo en cuenta que era imposible mantener los baños el 100% con tanto movimiento de visitas al día. En el baño de señoras había un inodoro que se llevó estropeado toda la semana que estuvimos. Y las mangueras de las duchas al estar picadas salía el agua y terminaba mojando todo el suelo exterior y con las pisadas al final eso terminaba estando un poco ‘embarramado’.
En resumen, calidad-precio bueno teniendo en cuenta que eran fechas altas de Navidad y para destacar lo más importante que hace que la estancia haya merecido la pena es la excelente UBICACIÓN. Al lado de Central Park, a unos minutos del Midtown, bocas de metro a escasos pasos y calle nada peligrosa para los viajeros solitarios.

title: Great base to explore NY
text: If you're looking for somewhere with the amenities of the Hilton, go to the Hilton. If you're looking for a bed, a shower and somewhere to store your items in your own little room, this YMCA is ideal. One of the cheapest options in the area, really good location near Central park and very close to a metro station. Staff were nice enough and overall it was ok. Yes the quality is nothing special, if anything it did remind me of a prison at times, but it did the job I needed really well. Would stay again.

title: Excelente localização.
text:
O hostel fica em uma localização perfeita, meia quadra do Central Park e 3 quadras do Columbus Circle, da estação de metro...Os quartos são limpos, roupa de cama limpa, possuem cofres, televisão com diversos canais e ar cond./quente.  
Mas, o colchão é muito ruim (colchões de mola), as toalhas encardidas. Funcionários não sao muito simpáticos. Fiquei em um deluxe room com beliche para 2 pessoas e banheiro semi privativo ( quer dizer que voce abre o banheiro com sua chave e somente voce usa o banheiro naquele momento, porem, outras pessoas usam o mesmo banheiro que voce) e não ter banheiro no quarto faz muita diferença. Mas pelo preço, compensou.

title: Stay here if you have an appetite for bed bugs and rude staff
text:
Absolutely terrible stay at the Y. We had booked a room with private bath this time after staying at the exact same Y around five years ago. This time, I REALLY wish I had not stayed at this absolutely disgusting and terrible place. I would give NO stars if Tripadvisor had this option. 

First of all, read and do not ignore all the bad reviews. They are all true. The check-in staff was extremely rude and tried to scam us. We had booked a private room with private bath but the first room they gave us was a bunk bed with shared bath. We immediately went downstairs after taking one look at the room and told the front desk staff that it was not what we had reserved. The guy at the front desk began by denying that we had made such reservation and said that our reservation had been changed and for bunk bed. Excuse me? The private room was twice as expensive as the bunk bed and so why would i pay twice the amount? He tried to make it sound like I made a change to the reservation and not the Y nor him who misread the reservation. 

Ok, let's talk about the room. The room we finally got was dusty, old and really more like a storage room. There was a fridge, but was unplugged and was being used as a bedside table. The heater/radiator was working poorly and EVERYTHING was dusty in the room. We actually had to clean the room before we can sleep on the bed. Then comes the worst part- bed bugs. We discovered bites on our arms, chest area and neck on the second day. The bites were extremely itchy and the classical three in a row. I went to the front desk, and guess what? Yup, they only had their "membership" staff on-site and could not help us. All i could do was call or email the reservations department. 

I looked up reviews in Tripadvisor and realized that the 8th floor had reports of bed bugs around 5 years ago. We were on the 8th floor this time, and I am guessing this issue has persisted. This totally ruined our trip and now we suffer from the itches. 

Oh.. and just like the previous bed bug post ---they will try to get out of getting the full refund back to you.

title: Alleen de ligging is oké.
text:
Man o man, een weekje New York met minimale slaap is heftig. 
Vanwege thanksgiving waren de hotel prijzen Sky high in New York. 
Het is mega gehorig, personeel is op een paar mensen na echt onvriendelijk. Bij inchecken krijg je je pas en mag je het lekker uitzoeken. Code voor dames badkamer geen idee, waarom je resort toeslag betaald? Mag je ook zelf uitzoeken. Stofnesten onder het bed. Dit is het duurste hostel waar ik ooit geweest ben. En ook de slechtste kamer en meest onvriendelijk personeel. 
Heb er verder niets aan toe te voegen, ben het helemaal eens met voorgaand commentaar. Ik ga zeker terug naar New York maar nooit meer naar YMCA.

title: Great location - great for only using hotel to sleep
text: We stayed on the 8th floor, private single bunk room with shared bathroom. The location was perfect and super amazing for the price, but then obviously the quality must be sacrificed. The halls and rooms look quite old and grungey, rooms are tiny which i expected that, but the bathrooms are suuuper annoying. You're lucky to get hot water at all, one of the 3 showers on our floor didnt even work, and then they shut the whole bathroom for a week for repairs so we had to go to another level. When the bathroom was open again, the only differences we could see were the 3rd shower worked, and fresh paint on the electrical panels. The showers dont have doors just curtains, and take your necessities in a shopping bag to hang on hooks on the shower curtain otherwise theres no where to put them and your clothes. All in all, a great stay, but would not stay in winter as after a freezing day in the city the last thing you want is a cold shower

title: Pleasant Stay, Excellent Gym Facilities
text: A pleasant stay at the YMCA. Stayed in a couple room that had one bunk bed, fairly comfy mattresses and sheets. The pictures included are the views from our window. Excellent gym, swimming pool and changing facilities. Preferred to use the showers on the gym floor as there were more, the cubicles were bigger and felt a lot more secure than in the shared bathrooms by the bedrooms. Staff at reception were also very helpful in accommodating the large group that I were staying with. There is a small cafe/shop that sold items perfect for breakfast, e.g. fruit salads and pastries. The location was excellent, a Starbucks and other eateries down the street and then Central Park being a couple of minute walk. Highly recommended for the money!

title: FANTASTIC! Could not fault. Ignore the odd bad reviews.
text:
So we booked this for 3 guys for 4 nights. The location is fantastic, bang in the middle of NYC.
Prior to arriving I asked for a larger room which they honoured. We got room 1367 in the top floor (13th). Three bunk beds in a very large room. Comfy beds, with air con and a free safe to use.
The toilet shower facilities on the 13th floor were very good. Good size walk in shower shower which was really hot and ample room to get dressed in.

Staff were friendly and helpful.

Your right by 59th Street Metro which you can get straight to and from the airport.

We couldn't fault our stay at the YMCA. We paid £450 for the 4 nights. BARAGIN!

If I go back I will return to the Y!

title: Lekker goedkoop
text:
De meeste recensies op TripAdvisor over YMCA west kloppen wel. 

- lekker goedkoop
- je komt er om te slapen en te douchen
- kamer is klein
- elke dag een schone handdoek en opgemaakt bed
- badkamers soms schoon soms wat vies (Lange haren, make up in de wasbak, make-up doekjes op de grond
- personeel is er om in te checken, niet om het je naar de zin te maken
- perfecte ligging
- in de avond wat lawaai van dichtvallende badkamerdeuren
- we hadden een mooi uitzicht. 

Wij betaalde 50 euro pp, geen reden om te klagen.

title: For price and locality you won't do better.
text:
Visited Hostel in mid November and was blown away by its location, just round the corner from Dumb Towers and across the road from central park. Hostel has a fairly grand facade and is well used by the community and appears to be a hub for many events and obviously the gyms and swimming pools are well patronised by the locals and guests alike. There is a small store within the building but its limited in its offering, however there is ample opportunity locally to pop out and pick up liquid refreshments chips and snacks. 
Its location of proximity to the Colombus Circle 59th street subway means it really is the gateway to all things to see on your visit.
The rooms are small and are cleaned every day with new towels and bedding, there is even a small TV to watch after a hard days sightseeing and yes the beds are not palatial in size but I never had any problem in sleeping on them. Toilets were shared  busy at times, but I always found them clean and perfectly usable. 
In short if your looking for a penthouse apartment over looking central park, you are barking up the wrong tree, but if you are looking for somewhere to base yourself while exploring the city which is in a great setting with friendly staff at a bargain price; for Manhattan this is the place for you.

title: Muy recomendable.
text: Lo que más me gusto sin dudas es la ubicación, el hotel esta más que bien fui con mi señora por 10 días y todo fue perfecto, los baños estaban siempre limpio, la gente deja sucio y eso no es culpa del hotel, pero el personal de limpieza enseguida limpiaba, sin dudas volvería a hospedarme ahí. Sinceramente eh leído varios comentarios negativos de este lugar y no comparto ninguno de los que leí. El hotel esta más que bien por es costo y lo único molesto son los ruidos por la noche pero esta lleno de gente y es lógico, pero por lo demás es genial. Increíble la ubicación.

title: Great customer service and folks were pleasant.
text: Visit in October and it was still warm, we slept with window open as the AC unit did not output enough cool air. Not sure if I would survive a summer with current AC unit. Customer service was excellent and location was perfect. The luggage storage was a bonus for us as we had a free morning before take-off via LIRR.

title: Niet echt de moeite waard
text:
Ligging van het hostel is perfect. Maar daar is verder ook alles mee gezegd.
Personeel komt niet echt geintresseerd over. Bij aankomst kregen we minimale info over het hostel en de omgeving.
Kamer was heel klein, stapelbed onstabiel. En er waren weinig stopcontacten. Wc’s en douches vaak bezet of de wc was verstopt.

title: Great location. In need of updating
text:
