I was in NYC for 3 days before I started a group tour down the east coast, and I knew I would just be sleeping in the room mostly so was looking for somewhere with a good location, as it was my first time to NYC, but cheap. This ticked both of those boxes.

I don't have many experiences with hostels so I decided to pay extra for a single room with a semi-private bathroom.

Finding West Side YMCA was relatively easy, just a few blocks down from Columbus Circle on the edge of Central Park. I checked in approximately 9 pm and while it is understandable to have only one member of staff on check-in, I had to wait approximately 20-30mins before I actually checked in due to a group in front who were taking a while, and for them then not to apologise for that wait didn't help, but my check-in process was much quicker. 

The interior of the hostel itself could do with being updating as it looks like its not been touched for a long time. 

I was on the 13th floor and while I read that there are some rooms with a great view of Central Park, mine was not one of them. The room itself was what I was expecting, again in need of an upgrade. The bed and pillow were surprisingly comfortable. Towels provided in the room, with only a short walk to the semi-private bathrooms.

Semi-private bathrooms, in this case, mean self-enclosed toilet and shower rooms but shared with the other guests on this floor. There are a huge number of them so I never found myself struggling to get in one. However, I always found it worrying, in case I opened the door on someone who hadn't locked it. Usually, guests would place their key cards in the frosted window to signify the bathrooms were taken, however, a more simple vacant / in use door sign would be better. The bathrooms were pretty decent considering, however, on occasion I did find creepy crawlies wandering about.

The shop in the hotel while open good hours 7-7, should be open later, especially for guests checking in later on and unsure of their surroundings, so they can purchase a drink or a snack. The breakfast yoghurt and granola I had on my 2nd morning their was delicious and I took it with me on my walk through Central Park. Like I said earlier the location was brilliant and only 5 mins on the subway to Times Square.

I didn't spend a lot of time at the YMCA during the day/evenings as I was out exploring so cannot comment on the communal area or swimming pool.

I appreciated the option to be able to leave my bags at the hotel after check-out so I wasn't traipsing around the city with them, although I disagree with having to pay to do so.

Overall a good stay but the YMCA is in need of a renovation.

title: If I could give a zero.
text:
First off, we were the first time visitors to NY. We thought moving about NY would be confusing and we wanted to be in the middle of NY so choosing location near Central Park would be best. That was our first mistake because getting around in NY by foot and subways were incredibly easy. So the first mistake led us to this ‘hotel/motel/hostel’ from YMCA. It is neither of those three categories. Not a hotl class to be sure and too expensive to call itself motel or hostel. 

We got a private “luxury” room with 2 bunk beds (sleep 4). First nigh, it was raining and water started to pour in from a window’s sill. Got some of our clothes damp because we left a suitcase near that window. We went down to “front desk” for help and get pointed to security guard for help. A gentleman from building support came up to assess the situation and of course the was nothing he could do. Later on we had an assistant manager came up and again nothing could be done and we asked for some towels to absorb some if the water. By then the rain had stopped, thanks GOD! The assistant manager promised some compensation for our troubles but we see nothing so far after a week. Oh, the beds are in bad shape, they are creaking like crazy with every movement. We did not have good sleep because we kept waking up when one of us turning. Not only that the noise on the hallway were loud at times throughout the nights when ppl talking or slamming doors. 

Conclusion, do not make the same mistake we made if staying near Central Park with a low budget bedding solution. For low budget, stay at the Bronx or Queens or even in New Jersey and take subways/trains to NY for day trips.

title: 價格實惠，其他差強人意
text: 位置好，距離中央公園三分鐘，距離地鐵五分鐘，走到時代廣場十五分鐘，地點完美，但是以我選單人房來說，空調非常糟，幾乎不冷，而且噪音其大，公共浴室到了晚上常常很髒，也沒人去補衛生紙，樓下櫃台的人員很多個常常面色不好、冷淡。另，只有一樓有飲水機，非常麻煩，且飲水機不提供熱水，熱水必須向一樓附設的販賣部「購買」，也就是買他茶，他給你一杯熱水跟一個茶包。我親耳聽到有住客跟他們要熱水（不是買茶而是拿水壺去要熱水），他們說不免費提供熱水。

title: HORRIBLE !!!!!!!!!
text: It was very bad, if you want to stay in New-York it’s better to sleep in the street than to sleep here. Moreover, the water in the showers is cold, we were trapped in the elevator. So overpriced, doesn’t worth it at all.

title: Worst showers
text: I’ve stayed in many hostels around the world and this is only one of a handful that I’d never return to. Yes the price for location is awesome but if you are female and allocated a 10th floor beware - you will either freeze in the showers or get burnt as there is no in between. The fact that the bathroom door doesn’t shut properly unless it is practically slammed also makes the door code to enter a joke as in the three days I used the bathroom the door was never locked. Even after cleaning the showers and sinks still looked grungy. I went in one morning as the cleaner was leaving and found toothpaste in one of the sinks. On our return from an overnight tour we were allocated a room on the 8th floor. The shower situation there was a little bit better in that you didn’t get burnt but unless you showered at 5:30am hot water was practically nonexistent.

title: Great hostel
text: This was my first hostel experience and it was a great choice.  Very well located, close to central park, fair price, clean rooms, full leisure, private bathrooms.  Great option! The staff was cordials, friendly, very nice place!

title: Sólo para dormir
text: El personal no es muy amable. El precio es aceptable para la habitación. La limpieza de las habitaciones es excelente, igual la de los baños compartidos. Las camas son cómodas y no hay ruido en la habitación. Si sólo se utiliza la habitación para dormir sin pagar los excesivos costos de otros hoteles en temporada alta esta es la mejor opción, además, su ubicación es inmejorable; a sólo unos pasos de Central Park. Además se puede utilizar la alberca y el fitness center.

title: Comodo
text:
Ho soggiornato a fine settembre inizi ottobre 2019 e devo dire che per risparmiare un po' è una soluzione comoda, in quanto si trova vicino a Central Park e a 15 minuti a piedi da Time Square. Ho alloggiato nella stanza 1271 al 12° piano e se potete evitarla è meglio: di fronte alla porta di entrata c'è una macchina di prodotti di bevande e snack che fa un rumore pazzesco per 5/10 minuti consecutivi poi si spegne e riprende dopo un po'....fortunatamente per la stanchezza la sentivo all'inizio ma poi mi addormentavo e nn sentivo più nulla! Se potete, chiedete le stanze che vanno dalla 1213 alla 1217 in quanto si trovano di fronte ai bagni (saranno circa 8/10) quindi è comodo uscire già in accappatoio per entrare in bagno! A proposito dei bagni....sono puliti (vengono puliti spesso) e abbastanza grandi: vi posto delle foto così vi rendete conto di come sono! Vi consiglio di mettere la scheda che apre la porta della stanza, visibile sulla finestrella della porta del bagno per far capire agli altri ospiti che è già occupato (anche se per entrare bisogna cmq usare la scheda e se c'è qualcuno dentro ti segnala con il rosso che è già occupato!). Altro suggerimento....dietro alla reception c'è un rubinetto di acqua potabile per poter riempire le vostre bottiglie da portare in giro per la città. A piano terra prima della reception c'è un piccolo bar per poter fare colazione. 
Non si pagano le tasse di soggiorno. Che dirvi io per il tempo che sono stato in stanza ho preferito risparmiare qualcosa rispetto agli hotel ed ho alloggiato qui, ovviamente bisogna avere molto spirito di adattamento. Pertanto ve lo consiglio vivamente.

title: a 4 day stay next door to central park
text:
well I had chance to stay here with a friend last week, it's very close to the massive central park and close to a shopping centre. This was a pleasant stay with shared bathroom/toilet nearby, it was unfortunate that I didn't get chance to use many of the amenities especially the swimming pool (i did read somewhere that you had to use a shower cap, not sure how true this was, I never did ask) had enough on my plate for the day plans lol.
it was also unfortunate that on our last night one of the rooms nearby seemed to be quite noisy for half an hour and a plug socket was hanging out of the wall but I didn't complain either. the bed did seem to be a bit noisy and could do with better pillows, one and very thin
There was ample storage as I wanted a bed for the night and nothing fancy as to spend my money around new york,there is trump tower within walking distance and the natural history museum which is amazing just 15 mins away.
For convenience, location and price I would stay here again, also managed to get a stunning skyscraper sunrise photo from my window

title: Terrible place
text:
Only good for the location.
Super ultra rude staff. Never met so unpolite people before.
Narrow, small, and dirty bathroom. Only one bathroom for the entire floor.
Ugly old room like from a psychiatric hospital.

title: Muy sucio. Hay otras alternativas mejores,,,
text:
Precio excesivo para la habitacion que se ofrece,por ese dinero hay otras opciones de hoteles mejores.
MUy sucia la habitacion, (planta 8)y hablo de nada mas llegar,, suelo que se pega al andar de la porqueria que hay, mesa sucia que ni se podia poner algo encima,manta que mejor ni mirar,,, el resto de dias solo entran y cambian la toalla,papelera que tuvimos que vaciar nosotros ,,
Los baños comunes solo un poco mas decentes a primerisima hora de la mañana , luego ni entrar,,,no reponen siquiera el papel.
El acceso tiene unos escalones que ppueden ser una dificultad para personas con movilidad reducida,carritos o si llevas maletas muy voluminosas , desconozco si hay entrada especial más accesible
Lo unico bueno,localizacion centrica y wifi funciona bien
Disponen de servicio para guardar maletas pero cuesta 2$ por cada una( el resto de hoteles es gratis)
NO lo recomiendo por haber alternativas mucho mejores al rededor.

title: I've never been to a prison but I imagine it looks like the YMCA
text:
My expectations were very low considering the low price. At check in, no one told me where anything was. They gave me the door key and sent me on my way. I happened to see the gym when the elevator stopped at the floor.
As we walked the hall, the signs didn't really tell us where our room was so we wandered around. Back to the jail thing - it really looks like you are walking down the hall of a prison. The doors look like prison doors. The room is a bed (which was very uncomfortable and it squeaked), a chair and a desk. The TV didn't work. Luckily the air conditioning worked. The shared bathroom is very small. The shower doors are see through and don't close - they just swing in and out. The sinks (one sink had a cockroach in it), are 2 feet away from the people in the showers. There is no shelf in the shower and nowhere to change. I think prisoners actually get more shower privacy.
But the location was AMAZING. It is within walking distance of everything.
The price was AMAZING. 
If you can put up living like a prisoner with no privacy, this is the spot for you.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text: En relación a la ubicación excelente. con respecto a la limpieza de las habitaciones, desastre. !!! solo cambian toallas y estiran las sábanas. jamás pasan un trapo al piso y mucho menos al baño. Una pena!!! el vestuario damas Excelente!!!

title: Micro rooms
text: Excellent place near to Central park and Columbus circle. Very friendly and helpfull staff. View through the small window on Manhattan amazing!!!  But: very,very small room with window witch I can not close  and only 3 showers on The 1 floor!

title: Great value for money
text: I was pleasantly surprised.  The location is perfect next to Central Park and only 4 minutes from the subway.  The rooms are small but everything in it what you need.  I had a room at the end of the hall, where I had my peace.  In the room is a safe, cleaned every day and fresh towels.  Only the bathroom: there is only one for men and one for women, not enough on my big floor.  At night too far to the toilet, so empty bottle used at night.  Wifi good but different sites blocked.  Prices are great.  Will book it again.  All staff nice.

title: Localização excelente!!
text: Localizado a alguns metros do Central Park, nós escolhemos por este motivo. Ficamos somente uma noite, no dia pela manhã saímos para correr no parque. Ao redor possui lanchonetes, cafés, rotisserie entre outros lugares para fazer uma refeição. O quarto que ficamos tinha 1 beliche e os banheiros são compartilhados.

title: Bon compromis
text: Auberge que l'on choisit au vu de son excellent emplacement. Les chambres sont nettoyées tous les jours et les sanitaires toujours propres. La décoration est quant à elle austère (ambiance internat) et pas très bien isolées du bruit. Mais compte tenu du prix, il ne faut pas être trop exigeants. Pour nous, cela nous convenait très bien, car cela nous a permis de visiter manhattan tranquillement. Si c'était à refaire, nous la rechoisirions.

title: Great location makes up for basic hotel
text:
The location is fantastic. The YMCA is minutes from the subway, Central Park, Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle. The gym and staff are great. We stay at the YMCA each time we visit NYC and make sure to use the gym, swim in the pool or do a class each day.

Whole foods market is just down the street. You can grab a meal and eat in Central Park.Since we spend very little time in our room, the YMCA, as basic as it is, suits our needs. You will meet guests from all over the world.

The rooms are very basic but clean. The shared bathrooms are cleaned multiple times a day.

I recommend staying on the renovated floor (11, 12, and 13) and requesting semi-private bathroom. Renovated rooms have a mini-fridge (those on the 8th floor do not).  I also suggest keeping your luggage sealed whenever possible. We saw a few creepy crawlies in the washroom and two in our room. We notified the front desk.

title: THE CITY NEVER GOES TO SLEEP AND THE STREETS ARE EVER BUSY
text: The rooms are very neat and the staff is extremely friendly. The place is in the middle of the city and is a walk-able distance to the Empire State building as well as the grand central terminal.The city is beautfull

title: Buena localización a buen precio
text:
La ubicación es muy buena, está al lado de Central Park y al lado de la entrada de metro de Columbus Circle, con lo que se llega fácilmente a todos sitios. 
Las habitaciones son pequeñas. Nosotros estuvimos en habitaciones con literas de dos personas y la verdad es que tienes el sitio justo. Lo peor es que los baños (y las duchas) son compartidos con toda la planta, así que recomiendo intentar ir justo después de que lo hayan limpiado. 
El personal es muy atento y se ofrecen a ayudarte enseguida. En la entrada hay una cafetería/tienda que viene muy bien para hacer un desayuno rápido. Hay fuentes para rellenar las botellas de agua.

title: Inadeguato.
text: Dovevamo soggiornare una settimana in questo hotel, tra le nostre richieste c’era il bagno privato, ma non è stato così. Un ostello, sporco, bagni in comune, personale incapace. Abbiamo dovuto cambiare struttura perché era invivibile. Sconsigliatissimo.

title: Central but basic.
text: The accommodation was very basic but the single room with bath that I reserved was certainly adequate in that it had an air conditioner, TV & mini frig.  The bed was very comfortable and there were enough towels.  The AC was a little noisy but I did appreciate having one as it was a particularly hot week.  I did appreciate having the mini frig as it was easy to pick up food and leave it in the room.  The best part of the accommodation was that it was reasonably priced and very central to everything.  The building was very clean and the service was competent.  Just be prepared for very basic accommodation.  I found that the central location more than made up for the lack of fancy amenities.

title: Ganz okay
text: Ich hatte ein Einzelzimmer mit Gemeinschaftsbad. Es war alles sauber, das wars aber auch schon. Wer nicht viel erwartet und einfach nur eine günstige Möglichkeit zum Übernachten sucht, kann nichts falsch machen. Die Lage ist perfekt.

title: Per chi sa adattarsi
text: Bella struttura, ottima posizione. La stanza a 2 è minuscola e con letto a castello, spazio veramente angusto ma non mancano wi-fi gratis, televisione, frigorifero e aria condizionata. Pulizia essenziale. Bagni in comune non sempre confortevoli. Il vero vantaggio è nel prezzo. Nell' insieme dignitoso e apprezzabile, ma è per chi non ha bisogno di grandi comodità ed è abituato a viaggiare. Lo consiglio a chi sa adattarsi e non mette al primo posto l' alloggio. Per me è andato benissimo.

title: MAGNIFICA UBICACION
text:
Para nosotros que estuvimos 10 noches hospedados ahí, estuvo muy bien.  La relación entre lo que te ofrecen y lo que pagas, es buenísima, ya que tomando en cuenta que la ciudad de Nueva York, es muy cara, este lugar tiene cuartos pequeño pero funcionales, a un excelente precio, solo me quejaría un poco de los colchones que no son muy cómodos que digamos, nosotros llegábamos tan cansados que caíamos como troncos y ni en cuenta de la calidad del colchón pero si eres alguien muy "especial" y busca comodidades de un hotel 5 estrellas, te recomiendo que busques, encuentres uno y lo pagues. Toma en cuenta que muchas de las quejas que tiene la gente que se hospeda aquí, es que no hace conciencia que está pagando un precio bastante accesible y que si hay muchos inconvenientes en cuanto a la limpieza es por culpa de los huéspedes, si fueran realmente personas consideradas por no decir limpias,  las instalaciones comunes estarían muchísimo mejor y no hubieran tantas quejas, en serio que hay cada persona que se hospeda en el lugar, que no entiendes su comportamiento, tan poco civilizado. Lo mejor que tiene este lugar, es su ubicación, está a media cuadra de Central Park y a dos cuadras de dos estaciones del metro; a tres cuadras tiene una plaza, en la cual hay WHOLE FOOD MARKET.
La limpieza del cuarto es diaria, el personal es muy amable y puedes usar las instalaciones de un club que tienen ahí, que consta de gimnasio, alberca y otras áreas para ejercitarse, eso también es un plus bastante bueno.

title: Para lo caro que es NY........
text: Esta muy céntrico y en una zona "buena",cara y elegante.Esta pegado a Central Park y desde la ventana ves un trozo de parque.Pero?..Las camas son literas,incómodas.Solo hay una silla en la habitación para los dos.Las duchas siempre bastante llenas a ls horas punta.Hay mucha gente joven y bastante ruido.Tiene un gran salón donde puedes comer tus cosas,en la habitación casi imposible por incómoda. Después de tanto patear quizás apetece algo más cómodo, pero para llegar y echarte a dormir, vale.Lo mejor que está cerca del metro que va de norte a sur de Manhattan y en la zona a cualquier hora hay de todo.Y el precio,por supuesto. Pagamos 800 e por 8 noches en Semana Santa.

title: Adventure!  Clean, Quiet, Simple, Great Price... don't get me started on the GYM ;)
text:
Delighted!  We had a double room with shared bath for 5 nights.  No carpet in the room, totally clean, great view out over central park, elevators worked great, unusually quiet.  

Of course we've stayed many times in much higher end hotels in Manhattan (and paid 2-3X the price), but this is a special place.  If you want a great workout while you're in town then seriously consider staying at the Y.  Staff is super friendly, wash and fold across the street does first 10lbs for $12, espresso drinks for sale downstairs, and lots of young international travelers.  

It's possible that some of the low star reviews were before the renovation?  Bed was totally comfortable, sheets a little thin but who cares?  Seriously, the value here is super -- it's Central Park West people!  If you want to blow all the money you save by staying here on shows and great meals (we did!) well... this can be a great option.  

Enjoy NYC!

title: Moyen...
text: Les chambres sont très petites, un peu sale, manque un peu de modernité et de propreté, il y a la clim dans les chambres. Les chambres doubles sont vraiment petite (lit superposée). Les chambres ne sont pas très propre. Point positif pour les douches, douches individuelles (avec un toilette, lavabo et douche) mais il vaut mieux se lever tôt pour éviter de faire la queue. L’auberge est très bien située, à 1 min de central Park et 2 min du métro (colombus circle). Manque de propreté mais très bien situé. Pour ma part, j’avais une très belle vue de ma chambre.

title: Buena relación precio - beneficio.
text:
Está muy bien ubicado, a 100 metros de central park, pero sobre todo a tres cuadras de la estación del metro columbus circle, por donde se paran casi todas las líneas de metro, lo que resulta muy fácil moverse a cualquier lado de NY. Las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero en NY, si quieres cuartos amplios sale muy caro. Los baños son compartidos pero pasan. Se tiene que pagar 10 dólares por noche, por el uso de las instalaciones deportivas (obligatorio), buen internet. 
En general muy recomendable para lo que cobran, tomando en cuenta su ubicación, y que sólo es para dormir.

title: Reserva Junio 2019
text:
Me aloje en habitación privada con baño semi compartido (el tema de compartirlo me preocupaba pero habia mucha diferencia de precio con un hotel). En el piso habia 11 baños para unas 70 habitaciones, siempre impecables!!! Si el baño esta ocupado no te deja ingresar asi que cero problemas. 
La habitación simple, escritório, tv,  lugar para dejar la ropa y frigobar. 
Todos los días las limpian y cambian las toallas (te dejan jabón) 
En planta baja hay una cafetería, con 5USD desayunaba (cafe con leche + 1 factura)
Esta a 3 cuadras del subte Columbus Circle, en la esquina Central park y caminando a Times Square serán 15min.
Hay recepción las 24hs

title: Great location but overall terrible hostel
text:
The only good thing about this hostel is the location, Central Park is literally a few steps away.

The room is very small, bunkbeds very insteady and makes a lot of noise.
Bathroom was terrible, there are only two bathrooms for the whole floor (and there are a lot of rooms!), The woman bathroom had 3 showers, but only one works!! Toilets were oke but fast out of toiletpaper.

You have to pay $10 dollar for a membership for gym and pool, even if you are not going to use those facilities!

No kitchen or refrigerator, no lockers for bags in room.

Even for this price I wouldn’t stay at this place again!

title: Súper precio y buena ubicación
text: Excelente ubicación y precio en Manhattan !! Media cuadra de central Park, puedes ir caminando a menos de 5 minutos del supermercado Whole Foods y estación de metro Columbus Circle!! Y 15 minutos de Times square. El lugar esta genial , calles seguras por la noche y varias restaurantes cercanos, el hotel es cómodo, limpio, baños limpios, agua caliente. tiene una tienda con básicos en la parte baja. Te guardan la maleta por dos dlls cada una en caso que ocupes, cobran solo 10 dlls adicional la noche por cuarto en caso de que te hospedes.

title: Desastre
text:
El hotel es un desastre! Pésima la atención, no te guardan los bolsos sino que te cobran uss 2 por cada uno. La ventana de habitación está sellada y no se puede abrir y tienen un olor espantoso. Los baños son un asco, los limpian muy poco. 
Las habitaciones hiper chicas. 
No lo recomiendo en lo más mínimo, es caro para los servicios que ofrece (que son nulos).
La ubicación es buena pero no alcanza sólo con eso.

title: Loved it here
text:
I stayed here for three weeks and it was brilliant! I got the single deluxe room which was a decent size, had a lamp, two towels, body soap, face soap and three blankets! Everything was clean and i got a great view of central park! Housekeeping was done every day, i never had to worry about clean towels. It was also nice and quiet. I slept great.
So it falls short of a 5 star review for one small incident. I had a bug in my room, i went downstairs to tell someone to get it out and the guy i spoke too looked like he did not wanna deal with me, was very rude, even though there was no one else around. The maintenance guy was very nice but the reception guy was not nice. But that's my only gripe. This place is cheap and in prime location. They also have a small cafe downstairs which was a godsend when it was raining.
ps - ask for the 13th floor. I stayed on both the 13th and 12th floor and by far the 13th floor is way better.

title: Localização privilegiada
text: Hostel simples que cumpre o que promete, uma localização excelente,com quartos de tamanho ok, sempre limpos. O banheiro compartilhado estava ok todas as vezes que usei em diversos horários diferentes, a equipe da recepção foi educada. Estação de metrô muito próxima, 15 min a pé da times e meio quarteirao do central park. Se procura um local bem localizado, com preço justo e sem luxo, é uma boa opção.

title: Caro para lo que es
text: Esta muy bien ubicado, pero compartir baño .. es un rollo. El wifi no funciona, y no puedes meter ni una cerveza ni comida caliente.. y me pareció caro, aunque en New York todo es caro.tiene policía en frente, eso está bien y da más confianza, aunque la zona no es peligrosa

title: Not for the faint hearted
text:
Thin bed blanket. Checked the sheets - they were clean. One pillow and one extra blanket. Two rather worn out towels. Bring slippers for the flooring. 
It all needs an update. But checking hotel prices, they start at $250+, so from that point of view, it’s an ok deal. 
Great location.

title: Habitaciones pequeñas. Baño compartido. No tan buen precio para lo que ofrecen
text: Habitacion pequeñísima con cama marinera. Baño compartido ( a veces te toca muy lejos del dormitorio). Dos dias notificaron falta de agua caliente. Sin desayuno. Check in a las 15hs. Cobran x dejar en guarda la maleta. El precio no es tan económico para lo que ofrecen.

title: Below average
text:
Stay for 3 days just because of the location.
The deluxe bedroom is ok for a single person.
The bathrooms for this category are ok. The only problems were that toilet paper and paper hand towels would run out at a certain time of the day and would be put back the next day only.
Another bugger  was that there cleaners would try to come in while I was using 3 times. I had to shout that the place was busy many times.
Staff were helpful when needed but it seems like they’re just sad to be there. They could be a little more positive when talking to guests.
I’ll look for another place next time I’m in nyc.

title: A fine place in a great area
text:
NYC isn't easy...hotels are rather pricey. The Y is fine. It is safe, clean enough, and this one is remarkably located. The room is small, with a nice window and view, and an old bathroom. I think the bathroom lacked the most--it isn't too small but the pressure was nasty, the hot water took forever to warm up, the toilet is too high, and the sink has separate hot and cold water taps. 
You won't find a better location than this.

title: Auberge de jeunesse
text:
Nous avions réservé une chambre ’de luxe ’avec salle de bains semi privée au13 ème étage . Chambre petite de 7M2 avec lits superposés très basique mais ayant l’essentiel.
Nombreuses salles de bains privées permettant ainsi d’en trouver une de libre sans attente et relativement propre , Nettoyage fréquent .Esprit auberge de jeunesse ou on peut y croiser toutes générations confondus.Beaucoup de monde,.Piscine et salle de sport ouvertes à tous mais nous n avons pas eu l’occasion de tester.Malgré  beaucoup de monde  nous n ’avons pas été jamais par le bruit la nuit.POINT vraiment positif c’ est sa situation permettant de visiter une grande partie de New York  à pieds et d avoir Central Parc juste à côté.  Métro à proximité de colombus circle 5 minutes. Petite boutique vous permettant d acheter de quoi déjeuner le matin avec café  et chocolat chaud.Possibilité de laisser ses bagages en consigne le jour du départ 2 euros par valise.

title: Good location
text:
I didn't want to spent too much on accomodation and New York is expensive. This was an ok deal with a great location, right next to Central Park, but shared bathrooms. My room was small and clean. The bathroom could have been better, the space at the toilets was tiny and the floor in front of the sinks flooded after showering. 
Considering the price, I can recommend the place.

title: Pour 2 nuits
text:
Vous êtes aux pieds de central Park rien à dire 
Vraiment très sympa le personnel agréable 
Douche commune reste propre et nettoyer 
La climatisation c’était une horreur pour nous 
Ça vibre sur la fenêtre, enfin bon c’est comme ça 
Franchement si vous êtes pas trop compliqué allez y !

title: Passabile
text:
Alla fine devo ammettere che non è andata niente male.
Tolto l’imbarazzo del bagno in comune devo dire che è stato un soggiorno positivo.
Ci sono comunque lati e punti negativi: pochi bagni a disposizione a piano, una doccia rotta al nostro piano mai sistemata in 8 giorni, pulizia un po’ approssimativa della stanza, materassi vecchi e rumorosi..
Però visti i prezzi di ny questo ostello può essere un buon compromesso.
Ha all interno un bar con prezzi più bassi della media, lavandino con acqua depurata (che ha fatto molto comodo) e tutto sommato le camere da due anche se molto piccole non sono malaccio. 
La pulizia dei bagni mi è sembrata molto buona e frequente e pure il personale molto gentile, c’è anche un buon controllo degli ospiti all’ingresso e per il ritiro dei bagagli in deposito (2$ a pezzo).
Altra cosa molto importante, entrata della metro a 300mt collegata a tutte le linee importanti, veramente comoda 
Insomma, non è il grande hotel, Bisogna essere persone adattabili, ma lo consiglio.

title: Very Welcoming
text:
Recently visited with my college, all staff were very friendly. The rooms were clean and spacious for 2, the shared bathrooms could be dirty or not properly maintained at times, but very manageable. Some of my friends in other rooms complained about their windows not shutting/opening, however ours worked perfectly. The beds were comfortable and we were provided with a safe to store money, passports, etc, which was a great help. A couple of evenings the showers were very full so I went at about 3am when I knew it would be empty to shower, it was at this point when they were quite dirty. 2/3 toilets were clogged and one of the sinks was full of sick. Luckily, there was just me so it didn’t stop me too much. One young lady in the shop/café area was very, very welcoming, helpful and a true asset to the hotel. I didn’t manage to catch her name, but she was from the Dominican Republic originally and had a beautiful tattoo on her right forearm. She was working the afternoon I was leaving the country, about midday on Sunday the 12th. She deserves so much praise and recognition for her attitude towards working and the kindness she showed towards visitors staying. She is truly an asset to the hotel. Please forward this onto her. 

[Photo attached is view from our hotel room.]

title: Splendid location and affordable
text:
My room on the  9th floor had a view extending (past roof tops) beyond Central Park.  The room was small but adequate, a bit chill on a weekend when the temperature had dropped the the steam heat was not on.  Bathroom was fine, though I suspect showering in the evening may be better than morning rush time.  Yes, shampoo and soap is provided.  

The bed was quite adequate and the desk was well set up for plugging in the cell phone and pad.  There's an easy to use room safe.  Refrigerator.  

The rather historic (1920s) building is well maintained and downstairs is well staffed.  The 9th floor had impressive wood floors.

The location is a block from Lincoln Center, ideal for visiting the Metropolitan Opera and all the other activities.  Three blocks south is Columbus Circle with, among other things, Whole Foods and a Kayser bakery, as in Eric Kayser of Paris.  You can live on baguettes.

title: Excellent rapport qualité prix à 2 pas de Central Park
text:
J’ai passé une semaine à New York et ai logé dans cet hébergement. La chambre double était très correcte et propre. Concernant les sanitaires, ils étaient propre et nombreux. 

A propos des commodités, l’hébergement disposait d’une salle de fitness, d’une salle de musculation, d’une piscine, d’un terrain de basket et même de cours de karaté. Je n’ai pas profité de ces prestations mais j’ai pu assister à un match de basket en tant que spectateur. Les petits déjeuner ne sont pas compris ce qui ne m’a pas dérangé outre mesure. 

Je recommande vivement cet hébergement le meilleur rapport qualité prix qu’on puisse trouver à New York pour un emplacement à une dizaine de minutes de Times Square.

title: ウエストサイド YMCA(アメリカ・ニューヨーク)
text:
独自の目線(5点満点)で評価しています。ビジネスホテルが中心です。

【立地】3
地下鉄の駅も近く路線も多い駅ですし、バスも利用しやすいので良いと思います。

【部屋】1
部屋は全く清掃ができておらず、床はホコリだらけでした。二日目以降も同様です。シーツの交換とごみは捨ててくれますが、床の掃除はないようです。初日のシーツにはよくわからない毛が数本ついていました。最悪です。

【コンセント・ＬＡＮ】3
数カ所にありましたができれば増設できるものを持っていきましょう。Wi-Fiはよく入りました。

【エアコン】3
普通に効きました。

【シャワー】1
部屋にはシャワーはおろかトイレも洗面台もありません。共同の風呂トイレは良いのですが使い方があまりよくなく、気持ちよく利用できませんでした。特にシャワーは着替えを置くスペースもなく最初はどうやって使おうか悩みました。結論は部屋で脱いで必要なものを持ってハダカで行くのが一番ということです。結構みなさんそうしているので遠慮なくしましょう。3階のジムでもシャワーが浴びれます。こちらは広めなのでいいかもしれません。ロッカールームで脱いでいくのですが、ロッカーには鍵がかからないので貴重品は持たないようにしましょう。

【スタッフ】3
フレンドリーで質問には答えてくれます。深夜のチェックインの場合は翌日フロントで更新をしないとカードキーが使えないので注意しましょう。

【総合】2
駅からもそれほど遠くなく周りの環境も悪くないので利便性は良いと思います。5分くらいのところにコンビニもあります。ただ部屋が汚すぎてうんざりしてしまいます。あとはシャワーの使い方がうまくならないと不便で仕方ありません。

チェックアウト後の荷物の預かりは一つ2ドルでしてくれますが、当日夜の21時までです。荷物の泊まりはないので注意しましょう。そういう説明がきちんとはないので遅れたらどうするんだろうと思いました。

うまく利用すれば宿泊費の高いニューヨークでお安く利用できるこのYMCAはいいかもしれませんが、やっぱり部屋にトイレが欲しいと思いました。

title: Precio y calidad razonable
text: Buena atención por parte de todo de todo el personal, las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero justas y precisas solo para llegar a descansar, el baño semi privado vale la pena pagarlo, siempre limpios y disponibles, habian muchos disponibles para las habitaciones del piso en el que estábamos, muy conforme con todo!

title: Best location in Manhattan!
text:
A tiny small room with a f ew amenities. Staff was polite and kind all the four days i stayed here. I felt lack of better options for breakfast. 
To be near the major tourist attractions and the 59th St Columbus Circle metro station make it one of the best hostel options in Manhattan
Would happily stay here again!

title: Um boa opção econômica
text:
Fiquei 5 noites neste hostel, viajando sozinha a lazer na última semana. Selecionei um quarto privativo com banheiro compartilhado. 

Cheguei 12:30 e o check-in era apenas as 15:00 mas meu quarto já estava pronto, o que foi excelente.

O quarto em si é pequeno, mas estava dentro do que eu esperava. Cama de solteiro (ela tem rodinhas, o que é desagradável pois a cama se mexe), espelho grande, abajur, mesa com cadeira, frigobar (não esperava, adorei), cabides, prateleiras, televisão, lixeira, cofre (o meu estava trancado e não pude usar, confesso que fiquei com preguiça de pedir para abrirem), janela (era para ser com vista para a cidade, mas me deram com vista para o prédio. Não reclamei porque fiquei feliz que pude entrar antes do horário do check-in), ar condicionado (não funcionava direito, aparelho velho e barulhento).  A minha janela tinha frestas pelas quais entrava ar frio à noite, o que foi muito desagradável. Mas como não estava tão frio, não reclamei. Caso contrário, teria pedido para mudar de quarto. A porta possui tranca de chave e trinco.
Disponibilizam toalhas de banho e no primeiro dia deixaram 2 copos plásticos e 1 sabonete, mas nos outros dias só repuseram a toalha.alguns dias colocavam 2 toalhas, em outros apenas 1. As tomadas são pessimamente localizadas no quarto. Uma atrás da cama e uma atrás da mesa. Tive que fazer contorcionismo para acessá-las. 

Agora sobre os banheiros. Fiquei no andar 13, onde existem 4 fileiras de quartos e 1 de banheiros, com algo que imagino serem em torno de 10 banheiros. Todas as vezes que precisei de um banheiro, algum estava disponível.  Sobre a limpeza: poderia ser melhor. Sempre haviam cabelos no chão do banheiro e rastros de usos nas pias e nas privadas. 

Em geral me agradou muito a escolha feita. O hostel fica muito bem localizado na 63 com a Central Park west, perto das estações 59 Columbus Circle e 66 Lincoln Center, além de alguns pontos de ônibus. Ao sair dele, você já da de cara com o Central Park. No prédio do hostel tem uma lojinha de conveniência que ajuda o viajante caso tenha esquecido algo (como pasta de dente por exemplo) ou naquele lanchinho à noite. Claro que eu gostaria de ter ficado em um hotel com banheiro privativo, realmente é a parte que mais faz falta, mas a diferença de valor é gritante e esta é uma excelente opção para economizar numa viagem à NY.

title: Excellent Location, Reasonable for Price
text:
This is my second visit to the Westside YMCA. The first was at New Year 2011/12 when I had a room overlooking Central Park and got a birds eye view of the New Year Fireworks. This time literally.no fireworks. The view was to an opposite apartment block, no problems not a new year.

The rooms are small but do have some, in my view, important inclusions, there is a safe. Not so necessary but  good to have is a TV, however, in a room for two people and being an LCD screen it is very difficult if nigh impossible to both watch and each get a clear picture. Another downer was the showers toilets on level 8, my floor (they do get cleaned well, I saw the staff doing them). But, as high volume usage areas they get very untidy fairly quickly (men's). Finally, I am a more mature person but do consider myself agile, until that is I tried to get to the top bunk in my room, It is one of the worse ladder designs I have come across being straight against the bed itself it was difficult to judge where the the rungs were when coming down.

On the upside, the room was serviced daily with clean towels. Also, the staff were all friendly and helpful, and the baggage drop facility is very useful. The hotel/ hostel is well located  being a few blocks from Columbus Circle/ 59th Street subway which gives access to the 1 & 2 lines, and the A, B, C, D lines. 

The 'A' line will take you directly to JFK, alight at Howard Beach (allow plenty of time this can take up to an hour) and change to the Air train servicing all terminals, hotel shuttles pickup, and Mall. Check in/ security queues at JFK are long so on international flights I advise to get there at least  3-4 hours before departure.

To conclude on the Westside YMCA, it is well placed, it is an impressive building, it is generally clean and has as many activities as you would like to get involved in. But it is on the high price side for what you get. But this is New York and I dread to think what even a 3 Star Hotel would cost in amongst the surrounding multi-million dollar apartments. For me, I slept well, and felt safe, and those are big pluses in the Big Apple.

title: Ubicación muy buena. "Hotel" destartalado.
text: La localización no puede ser mejor. Al lado de Central Park, a 15 mins de Rockefeller Plaza y cerca de Times Square. Si solo se busca esto entonces es perfecto. Ahora, no tiene nada que ver con las fotos, MUY descuidado y destartalado. Está limpio, eso si.

title: Evaluar de acuerdo a tu presupuesto otro hostel
text:
La primera vez que fui a NYC en el 2016 me hospede en el YMCA de Vanderbilt, mi critica eran las habitaciones chicas y no muy buena atención de los empleados, sobre todo un señor que te quería vender excursiones. Este año decidí volver a NYC y opte por YMCA WEST SIDE, no lo volvería a elegir, primero hay exceso de personas, por piso hay 3 duchas solas, las cuales están las 24 hs a full, en pleno invierno,e me tuve que bañar con agua fria, entre las 2 opciones vuelvo a Vanderbilt, sólo destaco la ubicación.
Otro dato no menor, es que no me quisieron llamar a un taxi para ir al aeropuerto, por cortesía lo debería realizar, se que es un precio accesible pero no por eso dejar de ser cortes. No vuelvo a elegirlo.-

title: Excelente lugar para descansar
text: Un buen lugar a precio accesible. Si bien compartes baños, vale la pena por su gran ubicacion. Si eres corredor, no dejes de llevarte tus tenias para correr en central park, a solo 200 metros del hotel.

title: Very good hostel in a superb location !
text: I have been there for some days, room was comfortable, showers a bit difficult for hot water, breakfast place is good and you can buy many good products there, and the best is the location !!! only few meters walking and you are in Central Park, which is the best place in NYC !!!!

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Cada vez que voy a Nueva York sin duda llego a este hotel. Muy reducido, pero suficiente para solo dormir, la ubicación es lo mejor que tiene, muy tranquilo el lugar para caminar a cualquier hora y muy cerca del subway. Además que tienen muy buen precio.

title: Muy agradecido, muy agradecido y muy agradecido
text: Fuimos a conocer NYC y el YMCA fué una excelente elección, Supercéntrico a 50 metros del Central Park, a 250 metros de la torre Trump y la Glorieta a Colón -Columbus Circle- y su estación del metro, un hostal siempre limpio y con costo muy accesible para estar en el centro de Manhattan, no tiene baño por habitación pero todos los baños son privados

title: Bom custo benefício e boa localização
text: Bom custo benefício e boa localização; fica perto do Central Park. O quarto é pequeno e, embora os banheiros sejam compartilhados, eles são individuais e acessados com a chave do quarto. Tem uma ótima piscina também.

title: Good deal for lodgings; clean, quiet
text:
Recently, I had a chance to stay at the YMCA for five nights, and while there, to try out some of their fitness center and exercise programs. 

As a cheap place to stay, I have to highly recommend the West Side YMCA. I had a tiny but adequate, clean, quiet dorm room on the 11th floor. I found the room to be comfortable, with adequate lighting and a bed mattress that while not as firm as I like, was still comfortable. Housekeeping came through daily and towels were supplied and also available from the fitness center. Downside was that the women’s room was quite a walk away, and required a login code, and had showers that have no changing space whatever. The entire floor is indeed a sort of crazy-making identical labyrinth.

Ground floor has a nice lounge area and a handy little convenience mart selling a few basic snacks and drinks.

The biggest downsides to accommodation at the YMCA were: frequent outages of hot water in the showers both for the residence and the fitness center; a wifi outage of several hours one day; and a sauna downage one day that I was there. 

One of the biggest upsides, though, was staff. Staff are universally professional, pleasant, and responsive at the YMCA – as has been my experience at several other Ys, too. Thanks to the staff!

It’s worth adding that it’s an terrific location. Walkable to Lincoln Center and MOMA and right off Central Park.

At the fitness center at this Y, I can only report on the pool, a yoga class, and the sauna and steam room.   The pool is one of the worse ones I’ve seen in Manhattan. The building is a former school, and the pool is small, aimed for a school population. It contained 4 narrow lanes when I was swimming there – the narrowest I have seen, and rather dangerous to share. It was busy. 

Yoga class, unfortunately, similar with my experience at another Y in Manhattan, was not what it was labeled to be, Adavanced Vinyasa yoga .  It’s true that I hit the class when it had a substitute teacher;  I hope the usual routine is closer to Advanced Vinyasa Yoga. I think staff should teach what the class is called.

Steam and sauna. Once back up and working, the sauna was really good.  The steam room is nice and steamy, but has an odd problem of being uncomfortable due to slightly sloped floors and wooden benches – one of which had a broken slat – that likewise slope and aren’t against the wall, and so you have to brace yourself to sit on them. Can’t comfortably lie down or rest your back. If the floor and seating were fixed, the steam room would be awesome.

All in all, here’s my rating:
West side Y accommodation: 4 stars out of 5
West side Y fitness club (based mainly on pool & yoga class): 2 stars out of 5

title: buen hostel para llegar a dormir
text: me hospede 7 dias y 6 noches por 800 DLL en una habitación para 2 en este hostel y lo mejor es la zona en la que esta ya que se encuentra a 2 calles del circulo de columbus, a 2 cuadras de estaciones de metro y a una cuadra de central park, es un hostal sencillo solo tienes lo basico pero esta limpio y lo mejor es que tiene un cafe starbucks y puedes desayunar ahi por buen precio, las habitaciones son pequeñas pero en NY . todo es pequeño mi unica queja son los colchones ya que son incomodos pero por la relacion calidad precio le doy 4 estrellas ya que solo llegaba a dormir.

title: muito gostoso.
text:
para quem for para passear e fazer comprar e pouco tempo para descansar ideal , ninguem te enche, eugostei pois saia cedo e chegava muito tarde.e ninguem te perturba e lugar aonde tem tudo e muito tranquilo
.

title: Económico, frente a Central Park, ideal para viajar solo
text:
Viaje sola, contrate habitacion doble ya que no quedaban singles, y me asignaron una habitacion para dos super grande, con escritorio y placard.
Nos llego nadie mas en las 3 noches que estuve alli asique la habitación quedo amplia para mi, la limpieza esta muy bien, las mucamas están todo el día recorriendo el hostel.
Los baños eran compartidos pero entrabas con la llave de tu habitación y lo podías usar solo el tiempo que quisieras ya que baños en el hostel sobran! por lo gral no lo encontraba ocupado.
Desayuno podes comprar en la planta baja, aunque yo solía salir a desayunar en mis caminatas al Times Square.
Cuando llegue eran las 7 am, y la habitación recien me la daban a las 2 pm asique deje mi valija en un cuarto que asignan para valijas, me costo bastante sacar el ticket (te dicen que lo saques en una computadora y es medio complicada la cosa) pague 5 dolares x valija. Y en esas horas sali a recorrer el Central Park que esta justo cruzando la esquina del hotel.
caminando desde alli podes llegar a varios puntos importantes de New York.
Mi experiencia en el West Side fue muy buena, considerando que tambien estuve en el Vanderblit Ymca, que si bien es mas cerca de Times Square, las habitaciones son mas chicas que en este.

Yo lo recomiendo.

title: Old facility, dirty bathrooms
text: I booked a single room with semi privatebathroom, which means on the floor there are several single bathrooms you can lock yourself in, but those bathrooms will be used by everyone on the floor. The bathrooms were often dirty, they need to be cleaned more often, and are obviously really old. Do yourself a favour and pack some Clorox wipes. The bedroom was basic, not a big deal I wasn't expecting anything special, but there were holes between the window and its frame and it made the room really cold. Position is good, very close to Columbus circle. It is also relatively cheap, at least if compared to NYC hotels.

title: not a great place
text:
Of course booking the YMCA we had a certain expectation, we knew it was going to be average but paying 100euro a night is definitely overpriced, even if it is New York. The fact that you can find a 3 or 4 star hotel for the same price is a bit crazy. 
The staff were quite unfriendly, except for one guy. We had serious problems with the heating in our room, we had no control to turn it down or off, so much so we were sweating all night, almost getting ill and having to leave the window open, in New York January weather. Again a bit unbelievable. We were told someone would fix this but didnt. The room was quite cramped but would have been okay if it weren't for the blistering heat. 
The location was good, right next to the park so of course that's an upside. However for what is completely a hostel with mostly non/existent facilities the price for rooms should definitely be lowered.

title: Great location
text:
We visited New York just before Christmas and were looking for somewhere to stay which was in a great location and good for our budget (we knew that we weren't going to be in that much and wanted to save our money for the sightseeing!)

This was an amazing location. We were right on central park and within walking distance of lots of key places (i.e. Times Square, Naturak Histoey Museum etc.) We were also about 5 minutes from a Subway if we needed it. 

The rooms are basic but we expected this. There are TVs and fridges which was convenient and we booked a private room with a private shared bathroom. These couls be busier in the morning but we never had to wait too long to uae the facilities. We alsi made uae of the pool (make sure you bring a shower cap!) And we could see there were lots of sports/fitneas facilities. The staff were all really friendly too.

Whilst the rooms were basic we would stay here again for the great location.

title: Rooms terrible. Access to central park ... awesome
text: This is a place to crash.This is the most stripped down accommodations in NYC.  Bunk beds are ok, very old but all is clean. Tiny dorm room with ancient dorm type furniture. Not a place to spend any time at all. Shared bathrooms are a gong show despite heroic efforts of staff.  Peak times (am) are tough and you will likely need to wait a few minutes for a shower room or to pee.  If you decide to wait for a less busy time, towels hit or miss. It worked for us to grab some  when the cleaning staff were around and stash them in our room (we were there multiple days).  Definately need shower slippers.  Or book one of the private bathroom rooms.  This all seems negative but this was one of the most memorable stays in New York of my life.  Take some classes, meet some awesome people, use the swimming pool (absolutely need a shower cap or you're not going in the pool). You are across the street from Central Park, the very best of central park. Every night we had beers at Tavern on the Green's patio, ran into Jimmy Fallon taping his show in Central Park and just the jaw dropping diorama of unique and talented people you find throughout central park.

title: Amazing Value For The Money
text:
People generally get put off by the word hostel but this place was great. 
We had the most amazing view from our room, which most hotels would charge a arm and a leg for.
The rooms were cleaned daily and there were more than adequate bathrooms for the rooms on each floor.
These were also kept spotless.
I’d definitely stay here again.
Yes it’s very basic but what do you need when you go to NYC? 
A safe place to keep your things while you explore right? 
This place is perfect for that.

title: Good and simple room
text:
I’ve been on this hostel once by myself and it was a good experience.

The room is simple, small, but the bed is comfortable. Just the TV in my room was not working properly. It is great because if you want you can use the pool as the gym as well.

This hostel is located in a good area and you can go to several touristic places on foot.

Compare the prices and choose this one if it is not expensive, because it needs to make sense with the price.

title: not a comfortable place to be
text:
My partner and I booked this “hotel” for 5 nights as we were looking for somewhere cheap and to just sleep as we knew we would be busy exploring the city. However this was not a place we wanted to sleep in and we only lasted 3 nights before checking out and checking into a hotel. 

We were located on level 4 with bunk beds (in which we were expecting). However this felt more like a prison cell as our beds were terrible with springs poking us and only one pillow and a light blanket each. We had shared bathrooms in which when we booked we were told we had a private bathroom. This was not the case the bathrooms were all in a seperate hallway and out of about 10 bathrooms on level 4: 2 you could not access, multiple had broken toilet seats at different times, the toilets were often blocked and it would take you at least 2 tries to find a toilet that wasn’t blocked or that someone wasn’t using, the sinks would sometimes have no running water, and there was a shower with no handle to turn the tap on and most had no paper towel. I felt dirty showering in these bathrooms and felt like I needed my partner there to assist to hold my belongings as there was no where to place clean clothes as surfaces were wet or had hair or dirtiness on them. 

To go with the disgusting bathrooms the hallways were noisy and the rooms heater was not ajustable and the tv reception would cut in and out or not work at all and overall just a uncomfortable stay and place to be. Highly disappointing as I had read some okay reviews before our stay. The only positives I have about this place is the good location with easy subway access and only a couple of minutes walk to Central Park and the staff were friendly enough.

title: Hospedagem com preço bom e ótima localização.
text: A minha experiência no West Side YMCA foi ótima, confesso que após dar uma lidinha aqui nos comentários ruins quase resolvi trocar, mas decidi arriscar em razão do preço e da localização e foi uma grata surpresa. Eu e minha prima dividimos um quarto duplo sem banheiro. O quarto possui um tamanho bom, suficiente para quem passa o dia inteiro passeando e só utiliza ele para dormir, possui um beliche de metal com colchões e travesseiros bons, roupas de cama limpas, espaço para guardar as malas, escrivaninha, cadeira, gaveteiro, ar condicionado, calefação e cofre (muito útil). Lembrando que fomos em Dezembro, ou seja, temperaturas super baixas, mas o hostel é super quentinho, não há que se preocupar com o frio quando está dentro dele. O quarto é limpo todos os dias e as toalhas também são trocadas com esta frequência. O banheiro é compartilhado por andar e dividido por gênero. O banheiro feminino possui senha de acesso, é pequeno, porém limpinho. Não é impecável, porque o fluxo de pessoas é grande, mas não que fique sujo, mas sim um pouco desorganizado. Após alguns dias de hospedagem entendemos os horários de limpeza e de maior fluxo e organizamos nossa agenda para uma melhor experiência. A localização é realmente o carro chefe, ao lado do Central Park, a 2 quarteirões de uma estação de metrô grande, onde passam as principais linhas e perto de um shopping onde tem lojas e restaurantes. Não utilizamos os serviços do clube, assim não posso opinar. Enfim, o hostel é simples, porém muito confortável para após um dia inteiro de passeios, possui um serviço eficaz de guarda-volume, check-in, check-out rápidos e uma staff atenciosa. Recomendo para quem quer economizar e ter uma hospedagem justa e confortável.

title: YMCA is youth in you in Action!
text:
YMCA West Island PointeClaire Québec
This is where you meet 
Health and connections of great value!

Investing in active life is lifelong Beauty 

Smile 😃 after getting the « Home of your Brain ». Clean healthy 
In movement ... in the flow
When 
Soul mind and Body meet others .

Get your joy back
The answer is
YMCA
A society investing in Wellbeing

Enjoy a massage !
Do gentle activity
Or enjoy a FAEME. cup of coffee by Sam the in-house Cafe barista

The front desk .... wow people!
Trainer to walk you through
EducAtion of the Body in motion. 

See you soon
AnnA & Robert of Roxboro

title: Super
text:
Je séjourne actuellement dans cette auberge qui est tout simplement géniale.
J’avais un peu peur après avoir lu certains commentaires mais je me suis vite fait mon idée!
Tout d’abord la situation est exceptionnelle, à 2 pas de colombus circle (shopping, métro, food..) et juste en face de Central Park. Bref vous êtes là où il faut en vous déplaçant à pieds. 
L’auberge en elle même: personnel accueillant, petite boutique au rez, piscines, sauna et salles de sport inclus dans la résa, même une salle de jeux pour les enfants. Vous pouvez remplir vos gourdes à chaque étage aux fontaines, super pratique !! 
La chambre: étant au 12ème étage j’avais une superbe vue de côté sur Central Park avec une fenêtre qui s’ouvre! 
La chambre en elle même n’est pas très grande mais juste assez pour y passer la nuit. Lit superposé confortable, bons matelas et oreillers. Petite penderie et commode pour ranger les vêtements. Bureau et petite tv également.
En ce qui concerne le bruit dans les couloirs, moi qui ai un sommeil léger je n’ai rien entendu! J’avais pourtant prévu des quies que je n’ai même pas utilisé!
Les sdb partagées sont très souvent nettoyées donc aucun soucis.
Chambre faites chaque jour également avec serviettes propres.
Wifi partout et avec un très bon débit.
Bref je recommande largement cette auberge si vous aimez ce type de logement

title: Gewoon goed!
text: Het hotel ligt op een perfecte locatie, vlak naast Central Park en dichtbij diverse bezienswaardigheden, maar wel rustig genoeg om normaal te kunnen slapen. De kamer is eenvoudig, het bed ligt redelijk. De badkamer/WC is gedeeld, maar erg belangrijk; het is schoon! Voor de prijs die YMCA hanteert op zo’n locatie in New York, kan je denk ik niet veel meer verwachten, ook al is er een zwembad en gym aanwezig (waar ik geen gebruik van gemaakt heb). Nadelig vond ik dat het in december op mijn verdieping (12e) erg warm was. De aanwezige airco kreeg het ook niet koel. Ook sloten niet alle deuren altijd juist, waardoor je geregeld mensen op de gang met deuren hoorde smijten. Ik zou zeker als alleen reizende zo weer een kamer huren bij YMCA, aanrader!

title: For a hotel, i give it a 5*
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights as it was super cheap.
Location - Perfect
Staff at the reception - Perfect
Rooms - Small, but beds were Really comfortable. Good that there was a safe in the rooms.
Didn't like that there was no carpets, but I suppose the floor is easier to clean without carpets. The rooms were warm (sometimes too warm) but it's always better than cold.
The showers were always clean, shame there isn't much privacy to change.

I would definitely stay here again

title: Te dan lo que pagas...
text:
El precio en comparacion con el resto de alojamientos es más económico y evidentemente no se les puede pedir mucho, aunque hay ciertas cosas básicas que tienen que mejorar. 

No hay control alguno de acceso al hostal. Estuvimos 9 noches y sólo nos pidieron que nos identificasemos para entrar la tercera. 

Dejamos las maletas en la consigna tanto al llegar como al salir y nadie comprobó que nos lleváramos el equipaje que nos correspondía, sólo miraban que cogieramos el mismo número de maletas que aparecian en el ticket. El precio de dejar 3 bultos fue 6$. 

En cuanto a la habitacion... Al llegar no estaba todo lo limpia que debería, te dan sábanas y toallas y eso estaba limpio pero el suelo y la calefaccion rezumaba polvo y suciedad. No tiene sentido que hagan la cama todos los días pero que no haya una limpieza en condiciones entre huesped y huesped. La ventana de nuestra habitación no cerraba completamente y se colaba un frequito curioso que en parte se compensaba con la calefacción. Las camas estilo hostal normalito ni bien ni mal. 

EL BAÑO! He de decir que es la primera vez que prefiero ir al baño fuera del alojamiento donde me quedo. Escogimos la opcion de baño compartido como siempre que viajamos y nos encontramos sólo con 3 wc para uso exclusivo de gente delgadita porque mas pequeños no los fabrican, de los cuales 1 atascado SIEMPRE y otro que no cerraba. 3 duchas también para gente delgadita, sin sitio alguno para dejar toalla ni repisa para poner nada mientras te duchas y tambien una funcionando intermitentemente. Un charco de agua estancada perenne en el suelo frente a las duchas. Cucarachas en los baños. 

No se si es habitual o si estaban saturados por ser fechas de mucha afluencia pero la verdad es que ha dejado que desear, igualmente estaba muy bien situado con el metro cerca y central park. El hecho de que no tenga cocina se compensa algo con que tenga un deli en la entrada.  

Lo recomendaría solo para gente con presupuesto muy ajustado y aun asi no se si compensa.

title: La localización es lo mejor
text: El lugar está bien si no quieres gastarte mucho dinero en el alojamiento, eso si tendrás baños compartidos y literas en habitaciones individuales o dobles. Nosotros no queríamos mucho más, ya que es una ciudad donde no paras y solo iras al hotel a dormir un par de horas y a ducharte. Tiene caja fuerte, amenities y toallas. Tiene un montón de servicios y es enorme, además cuenta con piscina, tiendas y guarda maletas. Volveríamos a repetir sin duda.

title: Tiny bed, not enough shared bathrooms, very noisy
text:
The only thing positive about this accommodation is the location. It is in a very nice part of the city.
I had a private double room, the bed was almost too small to fit both of us. Room was even smaller than expected. Could hear all street noise as there were holes in the windows that didn't close.
Huge gaps under doors meant could also here everything from the hallway, which meant 24 hour staff making noise, guests showering,etc. The showers literally screeched in your face if you wanted a warm shower, so bring ear plugs....
The bathrooms ran out of toilet roll and handtowels daily.
Given the cost of this place I really do not think its worth the price tag.
Have stayed in many hostels including in other expensive cities but none cost as much as this for how poor it was.

title: Great location!
text: I’ve stayed in a lot of hostels in my younger days visiting the US so knew what to expect. No frills but exactly what you need - clean room and basic necessities. Very friendly and helpful staff. Amazing location!

title: Impecable!
text: Si estás buscando un lugar para ducharte, dormir y seguir conociendo NY, ni lo dudes!! es barato, está super bien ubicado, a metros del Central Park y del Columbus Circle (distintas combinaciones de subtes; centro comercial). Los baños están muy bien, el personal es muy amable y tiene un mini drugstore para comprar cafe, frutas, bebidas, snacks.

title: Schlimmer geht's fast nicht
text:
Das hostel ist mir richtig schlimmen stockbetten ausgestattet!
Jede Bewegung führt zu einem extremen wackeln!
Das Bad mit Dusche und Toilette sind auf dem Gang . 
Morgens ab 5 Uhr hört man am Gang Türen auf und zu knallen , ein rumgerenne!
Schlafen kaum möglich. 
Bad Mega dreckig,  habe mich geekelt mir überhaupt dort die Zähne zu putzen. Jedes Gefängnis in Deutschland bietet mehr Komfort und ist sauberer als dieses Drecksloch!
Bleibt fern,  lieber ein paar Euros mehr draufzahlen !!!

title: 立地は最高。英語に自信がない人にはオススメしない。
text:
チェックイン時に予約者の中に名前がないと指摘されパスポートを預けてチェックインさせてくれました。

翌日別件でパスポートが必要なので旅行会社の予約票を持参してフロントを訪れたが、予約が確認できずパスポート返却されず。

英語での交渉に不安があったので旅行会社の緊急連絡先の方に通訳となってもらい話したい旨を伝えましたが、「あなた以外の誰とも話しはしない」と突っぱねられました。最終的にはスピーカー設定で無理やり交渉してもらい運転免許証と引き換えにパスポートは返してもらいました。

私の英語力だけではパスポートは返却してもらえなかったと思うので、交渉できるくらいの英語力がない人は宿泊を控えた方が良さそうです。

施設面については思っていたよりも快適でした。

13階フロアに滞在しましたが、共同のシャワールームもこまめに掃除されてるのか綺麗で快適でした。共同といっても個室で施錠できるのでプライバシーも確立されてます。自分の部屋にシャワーとトイレがないだけ、って感じです。他の階はちょっとわかりません。

フロントの方は偉そうな態度の人が多いですが、清掃係の人は親切で良い方ばかりでした。シャワールームが満室で待っていると、特別室みたいなところを解放してくれました。

室内には、金庫、冷蔵庫、机と椅子、ベッドがあります。ベッドはだいぶ柔らかめ。

あと暖房がだいぶキツく私は喉をやられてしまったので携帯用の加湿器などがあるといいかもしれないです。

ホテル周辺は徒歩1分くらいのところにコンビニ(デュアンリード)、スタバがありました。徒歩5分圏内には、TKTS、センチュリー21、レンストラン複数、コロンバスサークル駅があり立地は最高です。タイムズスクエアも徒歩15分くらい。 

英語力に自信のある方におススメです。

title: Una experiencia para no recomendar
text:
La verdad es que si bien en NY no hay modo de pasarla mal estando de vacaciones, debo decir que la experiencia en este Hostel no fue nada buena. Principalmente por el maltrato del personal, apenas entré a hacer el check in ya el de seguridad me vino a retar sin siquiera saludar, ya estaba discutiendo con otros clientes por temas varios, levantando la voz, y luego para dejar las maletas por poco me insulta porque yo no sabía usar la máquina de tickets para maletas. El maltrato fue generalizado, poco amables, y con mala cara siempre.
Tener un solo baño (de 3 duchas y 3 retretes) para compartir entre 30 habitaciones resulta muy insuficiente, motivo por el cual siempre estaban sucios y sin insumos como es jabón o papel.
Las habitaciones son pequeñas pero por el valor accesible cumplen su función, no me puedo quejar de eso, así como tampoco de la ubicación, que es lo único a destacar de este Hostel, la misma es muy buena. 
Desde ya no lo recomendaría, y de volver a esta increíble ciudad, recurriría a otro Hostel como el que elegí la primera semana de este viaje HI NYC HOSTEL, mil veces mejor, buenísima onda del personal, muy rico desayuno incluido, y encima más económico.

title: Dormir barato y con algunos beneficios extras, cerca del Central Park, y de Columbus Circle
text:
Si bien es un hostel, tiene un gimnasio, sauna y piscina para utilizar incluido en el costo del alojamiento. Esto es un plus, si te gusta relajarte al volver de recorrer la ciudad, o bien energizarte antes de salir. 
No tiene espacio para cocinar, ni siquiera para calentar, si bien hay mesas disponibles para los huéspedes. El único lugar que provee alimentos dentro del complejo tiene lo básico, por ejemplo, para no tener que salir sin desayunar sobre todo cuando el frío de NYC está en su esplendor, y dan ganas de tomar un cafecito antes de enfrentarlo...
Los cuartos son chicos, pero funcionales. Hay muchos baños disponibles, por lo que no creo que sea un problema utilizarlos cuando lo necesites. Seguramente habrá un horario pico en el que habrá alguna demora, pero si uno se adapta a ducharse según la disponibilidad, nadie te va a apurar. También se puede usar el vestuario del spa, lo que es una ventaja para tener en cuenta! (además allí tienen disponible secador de pelo bien potente! y toallas limpias en cantidad). 
Estadía de 4 noches, estuvo todo ok. No busques lujo en este lugar, pero sí hay buen servicio en gral y atención bien organizada y atenta para check in y out. 
La mayor ventaja que tiene sin dudas es el precio bajo, en comparación con otros establecimientos de la misma zona.

title: best value for your money
text:
If you are looking for a romantic gateway book a room 5 minutes from this location for  $$$$$ ( don't forget the fees, all kind of unexpected fees that come up at the last bill).
This is a wonderful location for the traveler, no matter the age...It is basic, you can choose from different kind of rooms, with or without a bathroom, it is handicap accessible (any regular room and  a special handicap bathroom not shared), the staff is friendly and wiling to help at any moment, it is clean, really clean everywhere, location is five stars, walking distance to Lincoln Center, Metropolitan Opera, Mall (Columbus Circle), Central Park, public transportation and all kind of restaurants.

We were there for a week, a family of three, we were able to see so much, enjoy so much mostly because of the location and the helpful staff we met.

title: 地點地點地點
text: 紐約住宿的價格很高，特別是馬拉松期間，選這裡最主要是地點。不單交通方便而且很靠近馬拉松的終點出口，除此之外就是"將價就貨"。房間及浴室都很清潔，可是雙層床的床架床墊枕頭都很舊。如可訂到有獨立浴室的雙人床房就很不錯。最好自己帶個風筒，或者晚上8時前洗澡。住了5晚，有兩晚是熱水爐緊急維修晚上11時至早上5時没熱水洗澡。

title: A little more comfortable than Central Park but likely less sanitary!
text:
The location is fabulous but sadly everything else will leave you distraught & depressed!

To anyone from a first-world country, it is a hovel! About forty years overdue for repairs & renovations!
Do NOT consider staying!

title: Scomodissimo
text: Camera minuscola e bagno davvero scomodo. Nessun appoggio per le proprie cose per la doccia. Pochi bagni per la dimensione della struttura. Camera con letto a castello e scala scomoda per salire. La struttura fornisce solo asciugamani minuscoli.

title: Great basic room, neat atmosphere
text: I stayed here with my 2 young daughers.  The location is incredible!  We were near our ballet, high-end wonderful bakery (Breads on Bdway) and a great, affordable deli (Melissa's).  We used the locker room bathroom.  I was impressed with the kind of people staying here, not scary, Europeans and nicely-dressed folks.  The staff were great.  The beds were very cheap/creaky metal and the mattress super cheap.  Such a great location!

title: Room with a ****view in a ** hotel
text: We stayed here during the NY Marathon 2018, room on the 13 th floor with bunkbeds and the greatest view on Central Park, with beautifull, colouring trees and conveniently close to the finish of the marathon. There is a nice pool and wel equipped fitnessrooms. Close to metro Colombus Circle, Broadway, fifth avenue and everywhere else we wanted to go, by foot or metro. Reception open 24 hrs, luggage can be stored before incheck or after checking out. Shared bathrooms, a bit noisy during the nights, people coming in till late at night. Friendly staff, I went swimming early in the morning and had the pool to my self for a little while, (except for the 2 lifeguards) and that in the middle of NY city!

title: Ero scettica e invece...:D
text:
Premetto: vacanza due donne (io e la mia mamma) quindi non una coppia,volevamo spendere poco ed essere vicini al centro.
Detto questo devo dire ke an sempre stata abituata a scegliere camere col bagno privato per ovvi motivi ma la città mi costringeva a spendere veramente tanto x soli 5 gg senza nemmeno colazione.
Perciò ho optato x il questa sistemazione ke si è rivelata super!camera piccola ma pulita con letti comodissimi e cambio delle lenzuola giornaliero(sempre bianche e senza una macchia),bagno condiviso ma diviso uomini e donne e pur essendo grande come struttura e non essendo molti i bagni per piano non ho mai fatto code di nessun genere e non ho mai trovato sporco o privo di carta igienica,sapone ecc ecc...avevo la stanza 1023 al decimo piano,qlk aveva scritto di condizionatori troppo rumorosi,io vi garantisco(sarà per la fortuna della stanza)ke il rumore si sente ma si dorme benissimo non è fastidioso...di fronte a central park,a pochi passi da times square e vicinissimo alla metro linea 1 tossa con la quale ho raggiunto la statua della libertà,il ponte di Brooklin e le ex torri gemelle.
Senza colazione ma non importa,fuori ai baracchini x strada i krafen costano 1 dollaro!
Il tutto a soli 550€ x 5 notti e alla fine solo per andare in bagno e dormire...a mio parere c sta e come!
Poi ripeto,non ero col mio ragazzo qndi ki preferisce piu intimità non lo sceglierà sicuramente ma a mio parere ,data la città cara,solo x dormire si può anke fare,consigliatissimo!:D

title: Económico para NY!
text:
El hotel está ubicado frente al Central Park y a unas 5 cuadras de la estación de metro Columbus Circle, lo que da buena conectividad para moverse por Manhattan. Es una especie de club deportivo con un piso de habitaciones. Las habitaciones no tienen baño privado, sino que hay un baño tipo vestuario en cada piso los cuales son bastante grandes y cómodos. El personal es muy atento, aunque no hay servicio de limpieza del cuarto ni desayuno.
En la planta baja hay un pequeño kiosco que vende café, lo que fue una excelente opción para tomar un café antes de salir a recorrer NY.
Creo que si bien es un hotel/hostel modesto, el precio es muy bueno por la ubicación que tiene y lo que ofrece. Para una estadía de un par de noches en la gran manzana donde la noche sólo se usa para descansar, está más que bien!

title: Good low-cost semi hostel
text:
The rooms are private with bunkbeds, TV and a small closet. Very clean.

You have to share the bathroom with the rest of the floor but it’s always clean and it’s rear that you meet somebody in there.

The location is perfect, near to central park and the subway... it’s a very good spot to stay for a few days and visit the city.

I would definitely come back!

title: Parfait!
text: Pour un budget restreint, c’est le droit où il faut descendre. 98€ pour une nuit. Chambre individuelle confortable, établissement tenu propre et surtout en plein cœur de Manhattan! Time Square n’est qu’à 5 mins de marche. C’est le même emplacement que les plus grands hôtels sans le prix.

title: Boa localização e custo
text:
Hotel com quartos simples em prédio antigo, mas com bom serviço e custo-benefício bom a julgar pela localização. (Duas quadras do metrô)
A Internet funcionou bem o tempo todo, água quente no banheiro.

title: Acomodação  boa, recepção ruim
text: A acomodação é boa e o quarto grande. A guarda de mala é paga mesmo tendo reserva, se você chegar antes do horário. Os recepcionistas são ríspido, não dão informações. O banheiro coletivo tem senha para acessar. Fiquei apenas uma noite, mas não voltarei a me hospedar lá por causa do mau serviço da recepção.

title: Not worth the money
text:
One morning we woke up because some other guest was given keys to our room. 
The staff didn’t do a thing even though I complained about it. 
We bought a luggage tickets the night before departure. And next day when we came to use them reception clerk told us they are only valid for yesterday, even though upon getting the tickets I explicitly asked for tomorrow’s ticket. 
Only 3 shower cabins per each floor. (50 rooms estimated ) 

The only thing that’s good is the location of the property.

title: Bien mais pas tellement
text: L'emplacement est merveilleux sauf que on m'a attribué une chambre avec fenêtre fermée et donc pas aérée du tout. quand j'ai réclamé cela à la réception, l'agent a refusé de me changer la chambre en disant que toute les chambres avaient les fenêtres verrouillées. Ce qui est faux bien sur car je pouvais voir que les autres fenêtres du YMCA était ouvertes. Ceci m'a beaucoup déçu. heureusement que je n'y passait que la nuit, et quand même les nuits était difficiles car ça sentais mauvais ( évident puisque pas d'aération ). La climatisation était bruyante et très forte en plus ça dégageais de la poussière. Je dirais que mon séjour magnifique à New York a été ruiné à cause de cela...

title: Crappy. The room stinks/MUY CUTRE
text:
We needed to spend one night in NYC and all the hotels were overpriced because of an UN reunion. That's the reason why we chose this place: more than 110 $ was the cheapest we could find for an apparently 'good' hotel. 
1st: THE ARRIVAL: The check in was impossible before 2 or 3 pm. Ok (not even a "we will try to do it ASAP" or similar, but ok). So we asked if they could keep our luggage (as ANY hotel in the world would do). "YES, IT IS 2 USD/BAG". whaaaaaaaaaaaaat!?!?!?!?!?! 1st time in my whole life I need to pay for that. 
2nd: THE ROOM: from the 1st moment we opened that door the smell of the room was awful. We tried to turn on the A/C which didnt clean that air, so we "tried" to open the "window" (pretty old, dirty, which didnt completely close...). Awful.
I have NEVER EVER made such a comment from any hotel ever, neither in Vietnam or any developing country I've visited. I felt totally swindled and we paid as much as if it was a good hotel. Of course I do NOT RECOMMEND this place at all.

title: Was fantastic
text:
I had a wonderful experience — so many wonderful people.
The staff and the other guests were fantastic.
I did have a single room it was clean - Bath room down the hall — clean and neat.
Short walk to the park and the train.  
Glad to have an airconditioner — even though a bit loud.
The gourmet-to-go shop down stairs had great coffee, juice, pastries and yogurt — and around and a nice common room to plan the day.
I did not use the other facilities — I will when I return.

title: VOLVERIA!!
text:
Me parecio la gente  de administracion diez puntos en todo como asesora, como colabora con el  bien estar de todos se ocupan de entender todos los idiomas, los he visto hablar con el traductor telefonico para  ayudar a pàsajeros.
Las mucamas un poquito descuidadas, algo  olvidadizas, se olvidan x ejemplo  de dejar toallas, jabones o algun  papel queda en el piso, enseguida  en el lobby te dan lo q necesites sin ningun problema.
La caja de segurida tamaño ideal 
La parte tecnica o de mantenimiento te soluciona todo en minutos y muy amablemente todo lo q necesites, x ejemplo mi ventana estaba dura, dificil de cerrar.
No es lo mas barato de NYork!!!, el Pennsilvania, tan conocido es un poquito mas caro pero aqui no tendras q hacer las colas  q en ese hotel son necesarias para  usar el ascensor.
Aqui no esperas mas de un par de minutos  cuando demora mucho, los tres asensores son grandes comodos.
Todo esta cuidado  con camaras,es muy seguro.
En NYork todo  funciona 24 horas, aqui tambien, haymaquinas expendedoras de todo lo q podesnecesitar.
Si te olvidas algo en los lugares comunes nadie lo toca. Muy recomendable para mi manera de ver.

title: Man får det man betalar för.
text: Rummet var som en cell, dörrarna (allt i hela rummet för den delen) va övermålade så många gånger att man hade svårt att stänga dem. Allt va fuktigt och det luktar lite mögel här och där. Ac som lät som ett jetplan. Hittade en och annan kackerlacka. Men billigt boende  ( för att vara New York) och mycket bra läge. Överkomligt om man bara skall stanna några dagar och man inte är allt för kräsen.

title: smart choice in Manhattan
text: Room was simple but clean. People were friendly. Location was great...It is a smart choice to save some money and stay in Manhattan. however do not expect the experience of a great hotel...It is an honest hostel.

title: Honesto
text: Atende o que se propõe. Lugar simples. Fiquei em quarto individual com banheiro compartilhado. Local muito bem limpo. Atendimento eficiente. Meu único porém fica para a qualidade do colchão. Extremamente desconfortável.

title: Pay for the location
text: Well, it’s a hostel. An average one. Although it could be improved in a myriad of ways, I think it’s worth because of the location. It’s still cheap for NYC standards, and if, like me, you don’t plan to spend too much time inside, go for it. Just don’t expect anything polished.

title: Great Location, Poor Everything Else
text:
The location is stellar—quiet neighborhood close to Central Park, Lincoln Center, and Columbus Circle subway station. Good restaurants in walking distance, and all the rest that Midtown has to offer. The other plus? The room itself was clean and a decent size for NYC.

The minuses: the check-in process was painfully slow and inefficient. Staff spent a lot of time talking amongst themselves about their break times and personal lives and ignoring customers. After checking in, we were sent to the wrong room (an already occupied room, I might add), and had to come back downstairs and repeat the check-in process with a different person. Also, we didn’t much like having to pay a facilities fee for a pool and gym that we never used. Finally, the luggage storage process we endured at checkout was awfully slow, clunky and poorly managed. They should get rid of those ancient kiosks (which were not user-friendly and were very slow).

All in all, I would not stay here again, despite the great location.

Another big minus was the shared bathroom. Of three available showers in the women’s toilets, only one worked properly.
